channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James heads to Ibiza to appraise a luxury speedboat worth over £100,000 and a diamond ring, while Lawrence values a piece of boxing memorabilia. Designer handbag expert Claudia must brush up on her history when she is confronted with a rare purse.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James hopes to sell a Second World War Tiger Moth biplane for £70,000, while two different diamond rings bought for £22,000 give the Prestige Pawnbrokers team a headache. Plus, a lord and lady try to sell some luxury handbags and a guitar signed by members of the Rolling Stones.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Single mother Jo Beck wants to move her family to Derby, despite her children being happily settled in Nottingham. Phil Spencer helps her decide if relocating is the right choice and searches for a suitable home. Also in Derby, Kirstie Allsopp offers advice to outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John Fairfield, who are looking for a property with a large garden, storage space for their sporting equipment and no noise from nearby roads.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: President of Moe's Southwest Grill, Paul Damico, goes undercover to check the standards he values are still being met. The company is one of the world's fastest growing restaurant chains with 10,000 employees and Paul wants to look for opportunities to assist his staff in a similar way to how his family were helped by his father's bosses during his childhood.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three more restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Things are tense from the start as Carole and Michael from Alston House challenge Marie on her comments. Next, Marie from Scotia House wants to set the record straight with allegations of tit-for-tat scoring. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the week's winners are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition heads to Manchester, where battling it out for the £1,000 cash prize are part-time DJ Dom, 35-year old barber Danny, trainee barrister Sasha, nurse Katherine and goth Maria. In the first edition, DJ Dom kicks off the week serving up a menu inspired by the 1990s `Madchester' music scene.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee barrister Sasha hosts the second night in Manchester, where she hopes to impress her guests with a Chinese-Pakistani fusion menu. Meanwhile, fellow contestant Maria reveals more about her love of gothic culture, and Danny discusses his soon-to-be-written autobiography.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Katherine hosts the third dinner party in Manchester, and she opts for a simple menu of a smoked salmon with horseradish cream starter, and a chorizo and chickpea main course. At the table, direct questioning and some extraordinary revelations cause some of the guests to feel uncomfortable.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Danny hosts the fourth night of the competition in Manchester, and decides on an evening of Bulgarian cuisine as a homage to his wife. His party ends with some Bulgarian language lessons that bemuse fellow diners Dom and Maria.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final night in Manchester and glamorous goth Maria is hoping to wow her guests with her twist on Asian cuisine. Some of the guests are feeling a little uneasy that the host will impart her love of vampire culture upon her menu, but the blood-free dishes even manage to impress daddy's girl Sasha. However, an avant-garde transgender dancer creates a stir, and at one point it seems possible that Maria has bitten off more than she can chew.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to solve the problems of first-time buyers in north London. Kirstie tries to end the house-hunting misery of Ify Okoye, who has viewed 90 properties without success. Meanwhile, Phil assists a couple looking to settle down in England after six years abroad - but discovers their ambitions may put their budget under serious strain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Noel Fitzpatrick continue with the week-long appeal to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, encouraging would-be owners to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part, with the team following adoptions as they happen.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples hoping to relocate to Surrey. Sonia and Daniel Alderson-Smith have a sizeable budget to find a new property in East Molesey - but have also decided there are only 18 streets on which they will consider living. Meanwhile, Phil offers advice to Maeve and Peter Dunne, who are unsure about which part of the county to move to.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows Kirstine and Phil, who have not spent a day apart in four years, but following an emergency during labour the pair find themselves separated. Cameras also focus on independent businesswoman Tyla. While awaiting the arrival of her third child, she starts to reconsider her romantic future. And although Spanish nurses Carlota and Javier epitomise the perfect relationship, the pair realise that labour can be challenging even for the best of partnerships.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana's `Wicked' Stepmother
programme.desc: An examination of the turbulent relationship between Diana, Princess of Wales and her formidable stepmother Raine Spencer, who rose from humble origins with the help of her larger-than-life mother, the novelist Barbara Cartland, to become a countess and a member of the royal family. Raine was a divisive figure, who was doted on by her husband Johnnie Spencer but loathed by Diana and her siblings. Yet as the princess's marriage collapsed, she reached out to her stepmother for support, marking a change in the women's relationship.(n)

programme.title: My Online Nightmare
programme.desc: This documentary explores some of the most extraordinary scammers and fraudsters who use the internet to lure and con their victims with terrifying, and sometimes deadly, results. This first episode examines astonishing cases of sex fraud, telling the stories of people who were tricked into thinking that the person they met online were someone completely different.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A poodle called Diamond has been referred for a total hip replacement, and another, with the same owner, needs a new knee. Noel Fitzpatrick operates on both dogs on the same day, and doesn't finish until 3am. Hopity, a 12-week-old Balinese kitten, has a deformity on one of her back legs, which she could end up losing, while the operation itself is a huge risk. Hazell has brought in Dandi, a five month-old German shepherd who is lame in both front legs.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: This is the juror's last chance to win up to £10,000, and new juror Paul joins the debate, but must convince the other members of the jury to vote in his favour. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr are First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, baker Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panellists choose between four different brands of prawn cocktail, margherita pizza and vanilla ice cream. There is also a public taste test of oven chips.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Trishna hosts the first of week of dinner parties in Cardiff, hoping her hip-hop-themed night impresses guests Yuno, Nick, Michelle and Suzanne as she tries to win the £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Cardiff, and host Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings with a massive tasting menu.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retail manager Yuno hosts the third evening in Cardiff, hoping to scoop the prize by giving his guests a taste of the Himalayas, as well as entertaining with traditional dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Cardiff is hosted by Michelle, who takes a risk with the third serving of lamb this week - and when she sets a fun challenge, she ends up being accused of cheating.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final night of the competition in Cardiff and tonight's host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James heads to Ibiza to appraise a luxury speedboat worth over £100,000 and a diamond ring, while Lawrence values a piece of boxing memorabilia. Designer handbag expert Claudia must brush up on her history when she is confronted with a rare purse.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James tries to make an £85,000 deal on a modified sports car, while designer handbag expert Claudia heads to Germany to value a large collection of bags owned by a former New York socialite. A female bodybuilder wants to sell jewellery so she can fund her new hobby, and a golf fanatic brings in a case of vintage wine.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James hopes to sell a Second World War Tiger Moth biplane for £70,000, while two different diamond rings bought for £22,000 give the Prestige Pawnbrokers team a headache. Plus, a lord and lady try to sell some luxury handbags and a guitar signed by members of the Rolling Stones.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Oceana, a restaurant in the heart of New Orleans, to try to change the fortunes of a business run by two quarrelling brothers. The chef soon discovers that the ingredients are of poor quality and could pose a health hazard, but he struggles to make his point with the owners without causing an even bigger conflict between them.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Professor Noel Fitzpatrick wrap up their week-long animal rescue series live from the Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter. Over the course of the week they have met furry friends from all over the country and tonight even more of them will make their way home to start a happier life with their new-found families. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Cavachon Stampy has been hit by a car and is in a critical condition, leaving owners Jim and his wife Karen facing a difficult dilemma - to take the chance and put their pet through painful surgery, or let him die. Golden retriever Dylan has a limp, and owner Stuart has driven seven hours from Preston to seek Noel Fitzpatrick's help. Meanwhile, Ginny from Chelsea arrives with her beloved dachshund Lilly-Belle, who has lost the use of her back legs.(n)

programme.title: The Mystery of the Crossrail Skulls
programme.desc: Documentary examining the discovery of dozens of Roman-era skulls by engineers working beneath London's Liverpool Street station. The remains have been identified as dating back to Roman times, but it has yet to be determined who these people were and how their heads ended up buried on the site. Archaeologists examine the bones for evidence of the various theories that have been suggested, questioning whether the skulls belonged to gladiators, executed rebels or the victims of a massacre, or formed part of a grisly ritual.(n)

programme.sub-title: All's Fair in Love and War.
programme.desc: Jill's competitive nature comes to the fore. Meanwhile, the mothers take Abby speed-dating in the hope the company of a good man will make her nicer to the girls.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: The girls struggle to get Abby's military-inspired group dance ready for the competition. Everyone is suspicious about Mackenzie's sudden foot injury, but the mothers are delighted to find out that Abby has secured a date with a mysterious man.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Jackie and Hyde go on a date, while Red and Bob throw competing barbecues to celebrate Veterans Day. Comedy, starring Mila Kunis, Danny Masterson and Kurtwood Smith.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Hyde has a party at his and Bud's place, but when Eric gets drunk Red is forced to intervene. Meanwhile, Jackie chats up a man her mother dated 20 years previously.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay loses her job and initially finds it hard being at home all day - until she rediscovers the rewards of full-time motherhood. Comedy, starring Tisha Campbell-Martin.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay and Michael enjoy a passionate moment in Junior's room - unaware their every move is being broadcast over the internet via his new 24-hour webcam. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Paul's well-meaning advice causes Kyle and Bridget to split up, and Kerry's first date goes well - but she is later dejected that the boy in question fails to return her phone calls. Comedy, starring John Ritter and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Paul challenges everyone in the family to give up their bad habits for one week, and whoever wins gets to choose their holiday destination. However, the contest is threatened by a variety of vices. Starring John Ritter and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Abby gives Chloe, Nia and Kendall a chance to step into the spotlight while Maddie is away filming a guest appearance on Ellen.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul and Steve make an extraordinary discovery inside a locked bedroom, and immediately call for police back-up. Brian and Graham head to Swindon Town football club to recover a debt, while Paul and Ben have difficulty evicting a couple from a house in Kent after learning they have six children and nowhere else to go.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya arranges for Karl and Sheila to put their bids to head the Liveability Committee to a vote. Amy breaks Toadie and Sonya's stalemate, while Paige's tough stance hurts Steph.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: Dance Moms

Martial arts adventure, starring Jet Li and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. One man, who has become amphibious, tries to protect a group of survivors by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: Auto Focus
programme.desc: Biopic examining the sordid secret life of Bob Crane, popular star of the 1960s sitcom "Hogan's Heroes". Based on the book "The Murder of Bob Crane", by Robert Graysmith(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risked her life's savings to produce and market her invention of the Miracle Mop. The success of that invention sparked her television-shopping business empire(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: A staid but well-respected prep school is enlivened by a newly-arrived, charismatic English teacher, who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Cantankerous Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski becomes a reluctant hero to his immigrant neighbours after saving them from a gang of hoodlums(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Enterprising teenager Joel Goodsen turns his parents' house into a brothel when they go out of town on a trip(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr. Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Rock Star
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in this modern-day fairy tale about the lead singer of a heavy-metal tribute band who joins the real group when its front man quits, and immediately gets in way over his head in a dizzying world of sex, drugs, and rock and roll. Jennifer Aniston, Timothy Spall, Dominic West, Jason Bonham, Timothy Olyphant, Jason Flemyng(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn. This gut-busting comedy is a sequel to the 2012 surprise hit(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blinded by toxic waste as a child, Matt Murdock develops superhuman awareness and balance which enable him to tackle New York's worst villains(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Based on a true event, the film follows the 2010 mining disaster incident where a group of thirty-three miners were trapped inside the San Jose mine in Chile for more than two months after a gold and copper mine collapses(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Bob and Walt are inseparable - they're conjoined twins. But things start to come apart when Walt pursues his Hollywood dream(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: The gloves come off when two best friends schedule their dream weddings for the same date, at the same place, at the same time and neither is willing to budge(n)

programme.title: Nine to Five
programme.desc: Colin Higgins' feminist comedy stars Jane Fonda, Dolly Parton and Lily Tomlin as three office workers stuck with an odious sexist pig for a boss. After her husband runs off with another woman, Judy Bernly must find work for the first time. Joining Consolidated Companies as a secretary, she is taken under the wing of super-efficient, long-time office manager Violet Newstead and fellow secretary Doralee Rhodes. The trio have the misfortune of working for Franklin Hart Jr - a first-class chauvinist, who will quite happily tip pencils on the floor just so he can ogle Rhodes' cleavage while she picks them up. When Newstead is unfairly passed over for promotion for the umpteenth time, the women head for Doralee's house to commiserate and smoke pot, which prompts revenge fantasies from each of them. But then fantasy blends with reality, and events spin out of control..(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: Simon Birch
programme.desc: Ian Michael Smith is a tiny bundle of joy as the star of this moving tale of friendship and faith. Simon Birch is a boy so small that at age 12 he plays the infant Jesus in a Christmas pageant. But Simon believes God has a special plan for him and sets out on a spiritual quest, joined by his best friend. Ashley Judd, Oliver Platt, Joseph Mazzello, Jim Carrey(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Before Jayson Blair made headlines for his plagiarized New York Times reporting, Stephen Glass defamed the weekly current events magazine The New Republic with a series of eye-catching, entertaining, and completely fabricated stories. Now Glass' trail of lies gets the big-screen treatment in writer/director Billy Ray's Shattered Glass, featuring Hayden Christensen in the title role. The film chronicles Glass' time at the magazine in the late '90s, when his colorful coverage of a hedonistic Young Republican convention, superstar web hackers, and the circus surrounding the Bill Clinton/Monica Lewinsky scandal made him the toast of the publishing world, garnering attention from such national publications as George and Rolling Stone. Barely out of college, the eager Glass ingratiates himself with the office staff, including his mentor, managing editor Michael Kelly (Hank Azaria). But when Kelly is unceremoniously fired and replaced with editor Chuck Lane (Peter Sarsgaard), Glass' pieces come under a greater degree of scrutiny, until one in particular threatens to expose his tall tales to the rest of the world. Based in part on a Vanity Fair article by journalist Buzz Bissinger, Shattered Glass premiered at the Telluride and Toronto film festivals before its limited fall theatrical release(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.desc: Ten years after a traumatic boyhood encounter with the forces of magic, shy science student Dave Stutler is again caught in the middle of the mystical fight between Balthazar, a follower of Merlin, and Horvath, who betrayed the cause by siding with evil Morgana - for the pair have brought the battle to New York(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
programme.desc: Following his surprise-hit American remake of The Ring in 2002, director Gore Verbinski took on Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl, the second of recent films to be based upon Disney theme-park rides (the first being The Country Bears). When Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley), the daughter of Governor Swann (Jonathan Pryce) is kidnapped by a group of pirates led by Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) and taken aboard their ship, The Black Pearl, Will Turner (Orlando Bloom), the young man who loves Elizabeth despite the fact that she is promised to another, sets out to rescue her. But he can't do it alone, so he enlists the help of swashbuckling ship captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp). Together the two chase after The Black Pearl, but they soon discover that the captain and crew aren't your average pirates. Cursed to remain between the living and the dead, Barbossa and his men look like skeletons when basked in the moonlight. When it is revealed that the only thing that can break the curse is Elizabeth's blood, Jack and Will are faced with a race against time and a battle against the undead to save the Governor's daughter(n)

programme.title: Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story
programme.desc: The brief but eventful life of actor and martial arts trailblazer Bruce Lee is portrayed in this drama, based on a biography written by his widow Linda Lee Caldwell. Lee is introduced to the study of martial arts as a child living in Hong Kong by his father (Ric Young); the father dreamed that a demonic armored dragon would take his son from him, and wanted young Bruce to be able to protect himself. Bruce continues his training as he grows to adulthood, and after the cocky teenaged Lee (Jason Scott Lee, no relation to Bruce) seriously injures a prominent British citizen while fighting a gang of troublemakers at a dance, he's sent to San Francisco. While working as a dishwasher, Bruce begins to study philosophy, and in time develops a personal martial arts discipline, Jeet Kune-Do, which blends Kung Fu fighting techniques with lessons gained from his philosophical research. Bruce decides to open a martial arts academy on the advice of his fiancée Linda (Lauren Holly); Linda and Bruce encounter resistance as a mixed-race couple, especially from Linda's mother Vivian (Michael Learned), and Bruce earns the enmity of traditional Chinese martial arts experts for his new style. But after a strong showing in several public tournaments, Bruce's fighting skill and charisma attracts the attention of TV producer Bill Krieger (Robert Wagner). Bruce is cast as Kato, the karate-trained sidekick on the series The Green Hornet, and while the show is short-lived in America, it's a huge success in Asia, leading to a series of films based around Bruce's remarkable fighting skills. Sadly, shortly before the release of the film that would make him a major screen star in the United States, Enter The Dragon, a mysterious brain disorder sends Lee into a coma that soon kills him. In a tragedy with eerie timing, Bruce Lee's real-life son Brandon Lee died shortly before this film was released, the result of an accidental shooting while completing the picture The Crow(n)

programme.title: The Fugitive

programme.desc: Lawman Wyatt Earp attempts to begin a new life by moving to Tombstone, Arizona but is forced back into action by the vicious Clanton brothers. This fast-paced western climaxes when Earp and his friend Doc Holliday face off against the villains in the famed battle at the O.K. Corral(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Shawn Roberts star in this sequel following an Iraq War veteran who is plagued by terrifying visions after returning home(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: A brilliant and beautiful college professor makes a terrifying discovery about herself after experiencing a frightening blackout in the latest installment of the shocking Species series. Miranda Hollander (Helena Mattsson) is a genius who is about to discover just how little she truly knows about the universe. Upon awakening from a mysterious blackout, Miranda is horrified to find herself surrounded by a mass of mutilated human bodies. When Miranda approaches her uncle in hopes of discovering an answer to this disturbing development, she is shaken to learn that she is in fact a half-human/half-alien clone. Now, the only hope for Miranda is to flee to Mexico with her uncle and seek out the scientist who created her. But it won't be long before Miranda is unable to suppress the killer instincts boiling up within her, and with an endless horde of murderous hybrids on their trail, it's only a matter of time before planet Earth becomes the ultimate extraterrestrial battleground(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: A cornet player at a legendary 1920s-era Harlem nightspot gets caught in the orbit of a notorious gangster and his teenaged mistress(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning Exorcist director William Friedkin scuttles deep into the darkest recesses of the traumatized human psyche with this tale of a lonely bartender haunted by the long-ago disappearance of her young son, and the paranoia that emerges when she enters into a tentative relationship with a deeply disturbed drifter. Adapted from the off-Broadway play by Tracy Letts, Bug centers on Agnes (Ashley Judd), who tends bar alongside pal R.C. (Lynn Collins), and has recently moved into a shoddy roadside motel in hopes of avoiding her menacing and recently paroled ex-husband, Jerry (Harry Connick Jr.). Upon making the acquaintance of subdued former soldier Peter (Michael Shannon, repeating his stage role), a veteran of the first Gulf War, Agnes finally senses that things are looking up. Quietly charming despite his melancholy aura, Peter soon reveals to Agnes that he contracted a "bug" while serving in the Middle East, and that it may have been deliberately administered as part of a secret military medical experiment. Convinced that the microscopic insects are quickly multiplying just under the surface of his skin and that they have now infected Agnes as well, Peter soon descends into a psychotic rage as he resorts to increasingly desperate measures to purge himself of the offending subdermal arthropods(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Johnsons set out from California for a family reunion in Missouri. The parents are split up, the kids are arguing - can everyone keep it together for the big day?(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despot's reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Director Peter Weir's first turn behind the camera since 1998's critically acclaimed The Truman Show, Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World is based on two Napoleonic War-era adventure novels in author Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, Master and Commander and The Far Side of the World. Russell Crowe stars as Captain Jack Aubrey, a high-seas adventurer who maintains a strong bond with ship-surgeon Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany). After conquering much of Europe already, Napoleon's forces have set their sights on taking Britain, so Aubrey and the crew of his ship, the HMS Surprise, take to the Pacific to intercept any attacking ships from the French fleet. When Aubrey eyes a renegade French super-frigate, the Surprise pursues, leading to an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea. Edward Woodall, James D'Arcy, and Lee Ingleby also star as members of the Surprise's crew(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul W.S. Anderson's turbo-charged, slam-bang tune-up of Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" follows the non-stop action taking place during a do-or-die contest pitting a convict (Jason Statham) against other cons, with the winner walking off with his freedom. Anderson admits to being "a big fan of the Corman movie," and this reworking is a glowing salute to Corman's original. Corman also serves as one of the film's producers, along with Anderson and Tom Cruise(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout
programme.desc: An ex-quarterback teams up with a down-on-his-luck PI whose quarry is murdered while he was supposed to be protecting her(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: As Above, So Below
programme.desc: A group of subterranean explorers encounter terror beneath the streets of Paris after descending into the city's ancient catacombs. Just when it seems their journey can't get any more nightmarish, the demons of their pasts strike back with a vengeance(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood makes his fifth and last appearance as 'Dirty' Harry Callaghan as the target of a sick betting game to kill off a list of local celebrities(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: Following a reprimand from his superiors for his somewhat destructive approach to his work, Harry Callahan finds out that his new partner is a female. Though none too pleased with this, the job has to come first - in this case, the city being held to ransom following an arms robbery by a gang prepared to blow up the toilets in the police station itself(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: A betrayed mob hit man goes the lam with his son, and seeks revenge against vicious gangsters. As the bullets start to fly, the impressionable child is exposed to the goriest aspects of his father's talents in this gorgeously stylized action thriller(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: In the Far East, Alex O'Connell, the son of famed mummy fighters Rick and Evy O'Connell, unearths the mummy of the first Emperor of Qin -- a shape-shifting entity cursed by a witch centuries ago(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A mysterious artificial being evolves faster than anticipated, and a corporate consultant is enlisted to determine the test subject's fate(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris

programme.desc: Hero's Journey. Louise and Matt rescue a dog that was hit by a car; a woman hopes to adopt a new companion after her beloved dog passes away. Meanwhile, Tia looks forward to appearing on "The Daily Show With Jon Stewart," but she might have to miss it when her dog gets sick(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Knife's Edge. A family from New Hampshire visits Villalobos in hopes of finding a new companion; an alert about an aggressive dog results in a heartbreaking discovery; Earl visits a spine specialist to address his chronic pain(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Shock to the System. A mission to rescue a stray turns into a terrifying ordeal for Matt, forcing Tania to take the lead. Meanwhile, a new recruit experiences the heartbreak associated with a life in dog rescue; and one of the center's favorites has a shot at a forever home(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: A Long Time Coming. A severely malnourished dog requires the entire team to nurse it back to health(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Low Rider. A dog has a tumor that could affect its chances of getting a forever home; an aggressive dog becomes a danger to the staff; Villalobos hopes to bring a stray and its owner together again(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Young Blood. A new inmate starts working at VRC, hoping to fill the big shoes that Country Matt left behind; Lizzy and Joe struggle to catch a stray in a nearby neighborhood; a family come to Villalobos to adopt a dog, hoping to fill a void in their hearts(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: A Girl Named Gun. A couple falls in love with a new best friend, but the adoption is at risk when Dr. Kristen discovers a heart murmur. Tia heads out to the swamps to rescue a dog in need of medical attention and is shocked by the diagnosis(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Ben Fogle catches up with a pregnant anteater that is due any day, one of the keepers prepares to leave and vets try to find out what is wrong with a much-loved tapir. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a Georgian flat in Burton-on-Trent, a former public convenience in Kirkcaldy, and a mid-terraced house in Rhondda before they are sold at auction, before meeting their new owners to discuss their plans for the properties.(n)

programme.title: Matron, Medicine and Me: 70 Years of the NHS
programme.desc: Antiques expert Eric Knowles explores how science has improved diagnosis and the quality of life of people with cancer over the years, and celebrates NHS porters. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: A woman who spends only a fraction of the average weekly shop reveals her secrets and the mark-up on gift hampers is investigated. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Newark, where he goes deep underground to discover a fascinating piece of local history, while Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson help the teams.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Angela contemplates a criminal act, Paudge fears that Nikki will find a missing suspect, and the Kielys reach a tipping point.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman and Jules Hudson look back at two searches in Oxfordshire, while Jules also learns how to make a famous British accessory and Nicki visits Blenheim Palace.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, the 17th-century Palladian house owned by the Marquess of Hertford, antiques experts Charlie Ross and Will Axon find great treasures brought by visitors including an interesting busby hat. Will gets a surprise when a Worcester coffee set goes under the hammer, and presenter Paul Martin explores the Battle of Edgehill.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones reach the final stop of the Big Causeway Crawl.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to sell some damaged tins of chilli beans and prove the erotic power of salami, but finds himself confronted with a customer's unhappy husband. Cyril and Eric seek advice on how to impress their wives, while Mrs Featherstone's efforts to secure Mr Newbold as a fourth husband suffer a setback.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Steven panics when Lauren insists on visiting her mother and looks to Max to help him stop her. Max also has his own problems as a pushy Carmel invites him to a family dinner, where his dismissive mood looks set to ruin things. Jack agrees to camping with Billy and Honey.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Eight - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the eighth night at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Defending champions are expected to go head-to-head with Olympic gold medallists in both the women's 200m and 3,000m steeplechase, with Dafne Schippers up against Rio 400m winner Shaunae Miller-Uibo in the sprint event, and Hyvin Kiyeng facing Ruth Jebet across the barriers. Medals are also decided in the men's hammer, and the women's long jump concludes. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy decide to attend a marriage counselling session. However, events soon put their relationship under further strain. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: Strictly Ballroom
programme.desc: A rebellious dancer's unconventional style earns him the disapproval of the ballroom establishment and causes his partner to walk out on him. Needing a replacement before a high-profile championship, he turns to an awkward beginner whose footwork blossoms under his influence as romance develops between them. Australian comedy, directed by Baz Luhrmann and starring Paul Mercurio, Tara Morice and Bill Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Nine - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day nine at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the men's and women's 4x100m and 4x400m heats. The Jamaicans won three of the four relays in 2015, with only USA's men's 4x400m triumph preventing a clean sweep, and the likes of Elaine Thompson and Usain Bolt may be rested in the 4x100m, where the champions boast significant strength in depth. The decathlon also continues with the 110m hurdles, discus and pole vault. Coverage continues on BBC2.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents preview of the opening weekend of the Premier League season, including Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City and Chelsea v Burnley.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The competition heads to Peterborough, where Charlie Ross ignores his own advice and the red team fails to pay heed to Thomas Plant's words of wisdom. Meanwhile, Tim Wonnacott travels to Exeter, where he visits the Royal Albert Memorial Museum.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander explores a semi in Bexley, Dion Dublin visits a Nottingham terrace, and Martin Roberts meets a father and son planning to knock down a Cornwall property.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple with a £600,000 budget search for a country home in Dorset with the potential to generate income. Away from the hunt, the presenter discovers how to make a traditional shepherd's hut.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents the general knowledge quiz as famous faces from BBC radio programme Test Match Special take part, featuring Graeme Swann and Alison Mitchell, Michael Vaughan and Phil Tufnell, Melinda Farrell and Jonathan Agnew, and Ebony Rainford-Brent and Henry Blofeld. The famous faces try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Co-presenter Richard Osman has all the answers.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Nine - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the ninth and penultimate evening at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where Mo Farah and Usain Bolt are set to make their final track appearances in the 5,000m and 4x100m finals respectively, hoping to add another gold each to their incredible medal tallies. The decathlon also concludes with the javelin and 1500m, and finals take place in the women's high jump, 100m hurdles and 4x100m, and men's javelin. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the opening round of Premier League fixtures, including Watford v Liverpool, Chelsea v Burnley and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City. Liverpool defeated the Hornets 1-0 in last season's corresponding fixture thanks to Emre Can's Match of the Day Goal of the Season-winner and will have expected another tough encounter. Meanwhile, Chelsea will have expected to get their title-defence off to a winning start and newly promoted Brighton faced a difficult task against Pep Guardiola's expensively assembled side.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: TV chef Rachel Khoo joins Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that made her the person she is, including a lasagne loving cat, and a duck that lived in a broom cupboard.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Ben Fogle meets an animal with poison so toxic it can stop a human heart and wildlife cameraman Louis Labrom attempts to capture the Siberian tigers in super slow-motion.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Newark International Antiques and Collectors Fair in Nottinghamshire, experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper help two teams pick up items to sell for profit at auction. Presented by Christine Trevanion.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes steps to ensure that fruits and vegetables give maximum cropping by dispensing advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as revealing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants that will carry on flowering into the autumn. Carol Klein meets writer Roy Lancaster as he reminisces on his life. Roy is a former Gardeners' World presenter, and with the programme's half-centenary in mind Rachel de Thame reflects on how people used to garden 50 years ago. Plus, Joe Swift and Flo Headlam help a community create a garden in Wiltshire.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: An exploration of the history and culture of some of the most extreme locations in Britain. Nick Crane visits the Isles of Scilly, Ruth Goodman walks the dangerous path traversed daily by the Branscombe Cliff farmers in Devon, and Mark Horton investigates the Transatlantic Telegraph service. Meanwhile, Hermione Cockburn learns how the fossil of a large sea creature found at St David's Head, Pembrokeshire, shaped scientists' understanding of Earth's history.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Eight - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day eight at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the opening three disciplines of the decathlon - the 100m, long jump and shot put, as the likes of Damian Warner and Kevin Mayer compete for the now-retired Ashton Eaton's crown. Plus, the opening round of the women's 100m hurdles and the men's high jump qualifying.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner visit Norfolk, where they visit a micro-herb farm and take a seal-watching trip from Morston Quay. The chef visits old friend Galton Blackiston at his restaurant, where head chef Richard Bainbridge creates a dish that reflects the local area. Dishes include grey mullet and brown shrimp in a herb sauce, and spatchcock quail with pearl barley stew.(n)

programme.title: Father of the Bride
programme.desc: A doting father recounts the story of his daughter's wedding from the announcement of her engagement to the big day itself. The experience presents him with a series of challenges as he deals with an escalating budget, tension with his new in-laws and the mixed emotions of losing his little girl. Comedy, starring Spencer Tracy and Elizabeth Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. He also traces the history of human settlement and considers the future of population control and food production.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Will Axon begin their final leg on the road in Gosfield, Essex, travelling through Finchingfield and St Albans in their search for collectibles before finishing at an auction in Ruislip, Greater London.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Eight - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the eighth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. The women's long jump final gets under way and is expected to see a close battle between the likes of Brittany Reece, Tianna Bartoletta and Ivana Spanovic. On the track, semi-finals take place in the women's 100m hurdles and 800m, and men's 1500m. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson. Coverage continues on BBC1. Live coverage of the USPGA Championship golf is available on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of reptile lovers take on three background actors in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of bubble, indemnity, Dutch and entendre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots, while Adam Frost uncovers the secrets of successful planting combinations in an Oxfordshire garden. Carol Klein chooses varieties of late flowering clematis as her plant of the month, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens and is now threatening rare and native plants, and Mark Lane joins the enthusiasts who have lovingly restored a walled garden in Warwick. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ore Oduba present analysis of the eighth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where four finals took place. Michael Johnson offers his input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Mark Urban.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of day two at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 6pm.(n)

programme.title: First Snow
programme.desc: A salesman stranded in a remote New Mexico town is told by a psychic that he will die the next day that it snows. As the weather grows colder, he becomes obsessed with revisiting his past as he strives to find a way to change his destiny before it is too late. Thriller, starring Guy Pearce, Piper Perabo, William Fichtner and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Normal for Norfolk
programme.desc: New series. The continuing travails of farmer Desmond MacCarthy as he attempts to keep his 17th-century manor house afloat and stay on the right side of bankruptcy. Now, hundreds of thousands of pounds in debt and with his overdraft at its limit, Desmond must conjure up increasingly clever ways to make money if he's to survive. The Wiveton cafe is beginning to thrive, but profits are devoured by the maintenance of the house and gardens. Desmond, with the help of his loyal team, begins to promote the Edwardian wing of Wiveton Hall as a place to stay and takes a booking from an international yoga retreat.(n)

programme.title: Fight Game: The McGuigans
programme.desc: Shane McGuigan heads to Las Vegas with Carl Frampton ahead of his rematch with Leo Santa Cruz. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Escapade in Japan
programme.desc: A six-year-old American is found by a fisherman's son after a plane crash in Japan. The youngsters believe that for some reason they are in trouble with the police and they try to lose themselves in the teeming streets of Kyoto, unaware that both their families are frantically searching for them. Children's adventure, starring Jon Provost, Roger Nakagawa,Teresa Wright and Cameron Mitchell,.(n)

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters find maturity and romance during the American Civil War, as they face tragedy and heartache, drawing love and support from one another. Oscar-winning drama based on Louisa May Alcott's classic novel, starring June Allyson, Peter Lawford, Margaret O'Brien, Elizabeth Taylor, Mary Astor and Janet Leigh.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Woodsman and TV personality Ray Mears joins guest host Ching He Huang to sample dishes prepared in the kitchen by chefs Paul Ainsworth and Tommy Banks.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Sat Bains joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to chat about the future of food and demonstrate his take on a traditional bread and butter pudding, using cutting-edge culinary equipment to create a modern twist on this classic dish. Drinks expert Kate Goodman picks dessert wines to provide the ideal accompaniment, while food writer Stefan Gates examines the pros and cons of meat that has been grown in a laboratory.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Nine - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the opening session on day nine at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the conclusion of the men's 4x400m heats. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Nigel and Adam's Farm Kitchen
programme.desc: Culinary writer Nigel Slater and Countryfile presenter Adam Henson follow the journey of more fresh food from farm to fork. They focus on chicken, the UK's favourite meat, which appears on almost every restaurant and takeaway menu in the country. Nigel visits eateries in Manchester for inspiration on spicing up his recipes back in the kitchen at the Cotswolds farm, before demonstrating a few alternatives to shoppers' favourites such as chicken Kievs and avocado dips. Meanwhile, Adam accepts the ultimate farming challenge - to grow exotic crops like rice and Asian mushrooms for a selection of international dishes.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look at the TV appearances made over the years by American Oscar-winning actor James Stewart, capturing the milestones and highlights of his life and career, which led to him being considered a Hollywood icon. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: The Philadelphia Story
programme.desc: A wealthy socialite prepares to marry an influential businessman and politician. However, her plans for the big day are disrupted by the attendance of her irresponsible ex-husband and a cynical tabloid reporter looking for a big story. Romantic comedy based on Philip Barry's stage play, starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant and James Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of reptile lovers take on three background actors in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of bubble, indemnity, Dutch and entendre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots, while Adam Frost uncovers the secrets of successful planting combinations in an Oxfordshire garden. Carol Klein chooses varieties of late flowering clematis as her plant of the month, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens and is now threatening rare and native plants, and Mark Lane joins the enthusiasts who have lovingly restored a walled garden in Warwick. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Georgian Treat.
programme.desc: Four modern confectioners use original recipes, equipment and ingredients to recreate the extravagant displays of a Georgian confectionery shop. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the foursome travel to Bath to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 18th and early 19th-century England. The sweet-makers craft everything from towering jellies made from boiled calves feet, glasses of Parmesan ice cream, and a final course featuring an edible landscape.(n)

programme.title: Iolo's Great Welsh Parks
programme.desc: New series. Naturalist Iolo Williams returns to explore more historic estates and parklands. He begins at Great Orme Country Park in Llandudno, which is full of history and ancient mines, and thousands of people visit the limestone headland every year for its views of the north Wales coast. Iolo also meets local wildlife experts to learn about the area's rare moths and butterflies, ferocious stoats and migrating birds.(n)

programme.title: Proms Extra
programme.desc: As the Proms season crosses its halfway point, Katie Derham turns her attention to the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain, which performed Thomas Ades' Polaris as part of Prom 28 last weekend. She also revisits yesterday's Prom 35, in which conductor John Wilson led his own ensemble in a rendition of Oklahoma!, by Oscar Hammerstein II and Richard Rodgers. Plus, David Owen Norris returns with Chord of the Week.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring is determined that all his men should be well-shod and have battle-worthy feet, so he starts a foot-hardening regimen involving lengthy route marches - which start to take a toll on the men after a few days. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn and Ian Lavender.(n)

programme.title: Alice in Wonderland
programme.desc: A 19-year-old Alice returns to the magical land, having forgotten her previous adventures. She finds the tyrannical Red Queen has begun a reign of terror that can only be ended by slaying the monstrous Jabberwocky - a task she is seemingly destined to attempt. Tim Burton's fantasy adventure based on Lewis Carroll's novels, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter and Anne Hathaway.(n)

programme.title: Performance Live
programme.sub-title: Performance Live - Flood: To the Sea.
programme.desc: A chance to see a performance of the ground-breaking drama To the Sea, the third instalment of James Phillips' epic four-part multimedia narrative Flood, which explores what might happen if England was destroyed by a global flood. Serving as a post-apocalyptic re-imagining of the flood myth found in Judeo-Christian scripture, the first part of Phillips' tale took the form of a short online film in which an enigmatic girl is dragged - still living - from deep beneath the waves by a North Sea fisherman. The second part, Abundance, was presented as a live open-air play at Victoria Dock in Hull earlier this year, and tonight's third installment asks a simple question: what if the masses of refugees, frequently seen on news broadcasts fleeing scenes of devastation, had English accents?.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of day three at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 7.00pm.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: David Jensen and John Peel present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 10 May 1984. Includes appearances from Belle & The Devotions, Queen, The Flying Pickets, Bob Marley & The Wailers, Terri Wells, The Pointer Sisters and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: At London's Royal Albert Hall, conductor John Wilson and his orchestra bring their signature energy and swagger to Rodgers and Hammerstein's musical Oklahoma!, which was an instant hit when it premiered on Broadway in 1943. The performers include Belinda Lang, Nathaniel Hackmann, Scarlett Strallen, Robert Fairchild, David Seadon-Young, Lizzy Connolly and Marcus Brigstocke.(n)

programme.title: Glen Campbell: The Rhinestone Cowboy
programme.desc: An insight into the life of country music star Glen Campbell, documenting his remarkable journey from an impoverished childhood to worldwide fame and success as a guitarist and singer with records including Wichita Lineman and Rhinestone Cowboy. Featuring contributions by family, friends and colleagues including Jimmy Webb, Micky Dolenz and Bob Harris.(n)

programme.title: An Evening with Glen Campbell
programme.desc: An archive concert by country music singer Glen Campbell in which he is accompanied by 80 musicians who played original arrangements of his greatest songs. Performed at London's Royal Festival Hall in 1977.(n)

programme.title: Black Music Legends of the 1980s
programme.desc: Profile of the enigmatic American musician, who rose to fame in the 1980s with hits including 1999, Kiss and Raspberry Beret. As well as achieving significant commercial success around the world, he won critical acclaim for his adventurous, genre-blurring albums, such as Sign O' the Times and Around the World in a Day - while also making headlines for his sexually explicit lyrics and stage shows, as well as his legal battle to retain control of his name and music. Featuring contributions by guitarist Dez Dickerson, Public Enemy frontman Chuck D, soul singer Beverley Knight and Paisley Park label president Alan Leeds.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: David Jensen and John Peel present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 10 May 1984. Includes appearances from Belle & The Devotions, Queen, The Flying Pickets, Bob Marley & The Wailers, Terri Wells, The Pointer Sisters and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: The Girl from Ipanema: Brazil, Bossa Nova and the Beach
programme.desc: Katie Derham examines the story behind Antonio Carlos Jobim and Vinicius de Moraes's song The Girl from Ipanema, which was written in 1962 and was later translated into English by American lyricist Norman Gimbel. Katie meets some of the key figures in Brazil's bossa nova scene and traces the roots of the genre to bohemian Rio de Janeiro in the 1950s, and examines its influence on modern jazz.(n)

Joe DePinto, president and CEO of convenience store empire 7-Eleven, is an ex-military man who believes in management systems. During his time undercover, Joe meets some extraordinary staff like Dolores, who makes hundreds of cups of coffee a day for her New York customers and Igor from Kazakhstan who thinks his job as a 7-Eleven truck driver is enabling him to live the American Dream. programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary

Finally, Sam and Nick throw the last party, but their rivals are uneasy ahead of arriving at their home, since the pair spent much of their time during a previous engagement discussing their plans for surviving a zombie apocalypse.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Professor Noel Fitzpatrick wrap up their week-long animal rescue series live from the Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter. Over the course of the week they have met furry friends from all over the country and tonight even more of them will make their way home to start a happier life with their new-found families. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by environmentalist and former Vice President of the United States Al Gore for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The trio offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: The community finally come together to celebrate Christmas Day, but Katie spends the majority of the day alone, still seething at the 'Valley Boys'. In the final days, the two groups' desire to mark their year-long achievement brings them together for one last hurrah, as they gather for a series of bonfires on the dunes before splitting for their last night. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents 50 clips from the internet showcasing the funniest and greatest alternative sporting and athletic heroes and fails. Featuring cats doing a workout, a woman who laughs her way to a six-pack and a weightlifter with a unique hands-free technique.(n)

programme.title: Contraband
programme.desc: Successful international smuggler Chris Farraday turns his back on a life of crime to raise a family. However, his brother-in-law crosses a powerful drug lord, who forces Chris to transport billions of dollars of counterfeit money into the US, or his wife and children will be killed. Crime thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kate Beckinsale, Giovanni Ribisi and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: The atmosphere remains hostile with the community effectively split into two - a mixed group in the summer camp and an all-male posse living in a valley in the woods. To make matters worse, the Valley Boys refuse to share their food, but when vet Rob takes issue with their behaviour, he ends up making a decision that leaves girlfriend Katie furious.(n)

programme.title: Damned
programme.desc: Comedy about long suffering Children's Services social workers at Elm Heath council. In the first episode, Nitin, an ex-copper, is tasked with spying on the rest of the team. Jo Brand, Alan Davies and Kevin Eldon star.(n)

programme.title: Damned
programme.desc: An unexpected outbreak of punctuality at Elm Heath's schools leaves the social workers baffled, and Rose uncovers an embarrassing truth while inquiring into an improper teacher-pupil relationship. Nitin wins the unenviable job of cleaning the council's most toxic kitchen, and Al quietly comes to the rescue of two clients with learning difficulties - and a new baby. Comedy, starring Jo Brand, Alan Davies and Himesh Patel.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

They also catch up with young couple Wendy and Simon, who were desperate to find their first home in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeny's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: On the Sussex coast, Sarah meets Paul and Ryan, who dream of a modern, stylish home with spectacular views of the sea. Unfortunately the only house they could afford is a small bungalow - with no views at all. The couple plan to create the ideal property themselves using their life savings, including a cutting-edge kitchen and a whole new floor. But will design headaches, heated debates, budgetary restraints and the worst storms in a decade derail the project? Plus, in the Buckinghamshire village of Great Missenden, Drachan and Susan want to transform their drab 1950s house.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart accidentally kills a bird with local bully Nelson's pellet gun, and vows to make amends by taking care of its eggs until they hatch. Featuring the guest voice of Phil Hartman.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer realises he has failed to do anything worthwhile with his life and decides to rectify matters by becoming a great inventor like Thomas Edison. Featuring the voice of William Daniels as KITT, Knight Rider's famous supercar.(n)
