programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at No 33 in Hunstanton, Norfolk, where owner Janie Thompson and housekeeper Gemma Layfield hope their quirky design and brand of luxury will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton, where father and son team Mick and Chris Emanuele run a basic B&B above their Italian restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Lansdowne in the Cotswolds for the third day of the contest, where Janie and Gemma like the rooms, but Mick and Chris are determined to find fault.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Ivybridge Hotel and Spa, where Mark and Jan Rummery bring their hospitality experience in Asia to Wales - but early impressions do not look promising.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to thrash out their issues. No.33 Hunstanton is up first, as hosts Janie and Gemma quiz Mark and Jan over their privacy problems. Next, father and son duo Mick and Chris Emanuele from La Tavola Calda want to put Cheryle and Anthony's sleep issues to bed. Eventually, matters are resolved and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Sandra Dodsworth and husband Peter find a house in south Orlando so they can be closer to their daughter, who moved to Florida seven years ago.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: A couple in west London spend £70,000 to completely remodel the rear of their Victorian property, while in Manchester, another duo use £30,000 to treat themselves to an extension.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp try to help a couple living in a flat on the River Thames in central London, who disagree on whether they should move. Gareth and Tina have owned the property for 10 years and Tina loves being within walking distance of work, schools, clubs and all the sights, but Gareth wants a big family home and Phil finds a detached house with a pool to tempt the family into the suburbs.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Britain at Low Tide
programme.desc: Tori Herridge and Alex Langlands investigate Merseyside's coastal archaeology. They explore a beach full of rubble from the Second World War and discover evidence of people and animals dating back for 7000 years. They also discover a story from Liverpool that echoes the plot of classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore!.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: The TV presenter continues his comprehensive exploration of the bombastic side of Hollywood, this time turning his attention to musical numbers that have elevated the popularity of their respective films. Over the years, Tinseltown musicals have touched on a wide variety of cinematic genres, from the family-friendly fantasies to urban dance and even more macabre territory via The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Here, Paul revisits Mary Poppins' tongue-twisting Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious, Pinball Wizard from Tommy, and a variety of numbers from Fame and Flashdance. He also sheds light on how Disney animation studios are keeping the musical genre alive, with blockbuster hits such as Frozen, which came complete with its own Oscar-winning girl-power anthem Let It Go. Includes contributions by Jonathan Ross, Celine Dion, Maureen Lipman and more. The concluding part can be seen on More4 tomorrow at 9pm.(n)

programme.title: Red 2
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Frank Moses reunites his squad of retired operatives for a vital mission. A devastatingly powerful new weapon has been stolen, and it falls to Frank's team to retrieve it - which means facing lethal assassins, terrorists and corrupt government officials out to steal the device. Action thriller sequel, starring Bruce Willis, Helen Mirren and John Malkovich.(n)

programme.desc: A heart-to-heart with Marilyn and Irene gives Roo a boost, while Hunter tells Peggy that Zac is not his real father - causing her to erupt in fury and reveal secrets of the past.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya arranges for Karl and Sheila to put their bids to head the Liveability Committee to a vote. Amy breaks Toadie and Sonya's stalemate, while Paige's tough stance hurts Steph.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine is found murdered in his garage, and inquiries lead the agents to his former sergeant. However, Gibbs and the team soon find out that their man is under FBI witness protection as he is about to testify against a mobster, giving him a cast-iron alibi. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: Jesse Stone: Night Passage
programme.desc: An alcoholic cop is fired from the LAPD and starts a new life in a Boston suburb, where the town board recruits him as chief of police. During an investigation into the death of his predecessor, he gets caught up in what seems to be a straightforward case of domestic abuse, but ends up on the trail of a money-laundering scheme. Detective thriller, starring Tom Selleck, Stephanie March and Stephen Baldwin. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya arranges for Karl and Sheila to put their bids to head the Liveability Committee to a vote. Amy breaks Toadie and Sonya's stalemate, while Paige's tough stance hurts Steph.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: A heart-to-heart with Marilyn and Irene gives Roo a boost, while Hunter tells Peggy that Zac is not his real father - causing her to erupt in fury and reveal secrets of the past.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: 20 Moments
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents a countdown of some of the most memorable moments from the decade, a period shaped by the rise of reality TV and social media. World-changing events in the headlines included the election of Barack Obama, the 9/11 terrorist attacks and the introduction of the Civil Partnership Act to the UK. Gnarls Barkley made musical history when Crazy went to number one on downloads alone, while the England cricket team regained the Ashes for the first time in 18 years.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the first live eviction show of the series. As usual, she presents yesterday's highlights before revealing which of the renowned residents will be leaving tonight and talking to her about being cooped up with their fellow famous faces.(n)

programme.title: Make or Break
programme.desc: Tensions on the Mexican resort continue to rise, as the participants get physical with their latest partners. After fleeing from a sex therapy session in tears, Holly now faces further turmoil as Karl gets closer to Abbi. Meanwhile, warring duo Elle and Andy make the ultimate decision.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the CBB companion show, featuring gossip, chat and features from the house. Guests and the studio audience discuss tonight's eviction, debating whether the right housemate has left.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the first live eviction show of the series. As usual, she presents yesterday's highlights before revealing which of the renowned residents will be leaving tonight and talking to her about being cooped up with their fellow famous faces.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Nick Wallis shows how CCTV and technological advances are helping tackle the problem of violent crime, from burglaries to muggings and street fights. In west London, camera operators assist police as they try to enforce a drinking ban on a newly renovated park in Hammersmith, and later give guidance to officers after they spot a youth armed with a knife prowling the streets in the early hours.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton offer advice to the would-be sellers of a four-bedroom house in the Gloucestershire village of Nailsworth. From the outside, the property looks spectacular, but once inside it appears drab and cluttered - and the fact the family's pet rabbit uses the verandah as a lavatory does not help.(n)

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Cambridge academic Paul Binski continues his fact-finding journey through the history of religious art, visiting St Giles in Cheadle, Staffordshire, and the Free Church in Glasgow to see how Augustus Pugin and Alexander `Greek' Thomson, two notable Victorian architects, rejected the prevailing industrialism of their era and drew inspiration from the grandeur of the past.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Poppy Cat
programme.desc: Mo accidentally breaks Zuzu's prized new frog clock, so Owl suggests a visit to the Magical Forest to find the Clock Pixies, who might be able to help fix it.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: I Want to Be a Cavegirl.
programme.desc: The youngster moves into the garden shed to live as a cave girl, but finds it is not much fun once night falls.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Stubborn refuses to believe in werewolves, and Mr Lazy is mistaken for an ancient Egyptian mummy during a visit to the museum.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The puppet joins some of his friends for some flowery fun as they learn how to bake bread. Children's fun with the monkey, who sets out to learn everything about the world.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Bopping About
programme.desc: More dancing fun as Kemi and David shake their bodies like a maraca.(n)

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are in for a surprise when they spend a night in grandpa's vegetable garden.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa discover how worms in Grandpa's compost heap transform vegetable peelings into fertiliser.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Hayley the harvest mouse goes missing and her neighbour Marcus needs help to find her, so Wissper summons Stripes, the tiger, who is good at tracking.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and his canine crew help Cap'n Turbot move a beehive across the bay to a much safer home with Farmer Al.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and the team are commissioned to build the new Spring City Clock, the work goes well until they realise some of the pieces are missing.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The annual Pontypandy Cheese Roll Challenge takes place, but Norman Price diverts the path of the cheese to the edge of a cliff and finds himself in big trouble.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Bazza's homemade soup gives all the vehicles engine trouble, so Olly helps Cody to get everyone to the garage.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: Bertie and Olly investigate whether a UFO sighting was real or a hoax for the local newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: On a road trip through the savannah, the pups meet a lost baby elephant and rescue her mum from a deep ravine.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: The trucks celebrate Darington's birthday, but Crusher has his eye on the cake, and when he tries to steal it, the delicious dessert goes rocketing away. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Toyland Accidents.
programme.desc: Trees are falling down and machines are going crazy, and Noddy needs to use all his investigating skills to find out who is causing all the trouble.(n)

programme.title: Floogals
programme.desc: The trio try to understand how strange sounds can come from a black disc.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: A magical card appears in the Little Kingdom inviting everybody to a party at Granny and Granpapa Thistle's castle in the clouds, where surprises await them.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Zeta steals Princess Samira's necklace, and the girls must get it back before the sorceress discovers its special power.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Chips catches a shell in his fishing net, and he is certain he has found a fabled `Sea Nut', but then it starts travelling around by itself.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Richard Rabbit plays with George, and Suzy Sheep keeps Peppa company.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig enters a race to raise money for the school roof, and finds he runs quicker when a wasp chases him.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Strange holes appear throughout the Little Kingdom, and it becomes apparent that the dwarves are digging for treasure.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Crime-fighting capers with the heroes in a half-shell. The four brothers, Casey and April are rescued from oblivion by a friendly robot.(n)

programme.title: Make You Laugh Out Loud
programme.sub-title: Budgies Make You Laugh Out Loud.
programme.desc: Compilation of internet videos featuring the antics of budgies and other birds, from flying fails to performing parrots and real-life angry birds. The programme also goes behind the scenes of some of the most successful viral clips, including a foul-mouthed cockatoo and the Picasso of the parrot world. Narrated by Iain Lee and featuring contributions by self-confessed video junkies Ellie Taylor, Des Clarke and Felicity Ward.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev Salter and Ian Squire hunt for a man roaming the late-night streets with a machete, while the driver of a Ford Fiesta takes a pursuit off-road. Elsewhere, an uninsured boy racer takes his mum's car out for a spin with his mates, but leaves a trail of destruction in his wake, and a call comes in about a sharpshooter who is drunk and looking for a fight.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Damien Stevens draws his stun gun on an aggressive driver, while the hunt for a suspected armed robber turns up a nasty surprise for dog handler Jimmy Grieves. Paul Jackson grapples with a man armed with a machete, and officers get kitted up to raid the home of a suspected cannabis grower.(n)

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: The series following British people living in Benidorm returns. The owner of an auction house goes in search of new stock, while a recovering drug addict working as a fitness instructor tries to solve his financial troubles with a street party. Campsite entertainment manager Graham, who appeared in the first series, looks for new acts as business improves, and an estate agent hopes to sell her first house.(n)

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: This episode catches up with stars of the first series Wayne and Des. Since they last appeared, they have bought their marital home and are now setting up a charity to help mothers and children in need. The ex-pat community rally round to help with a fundraising event. A wedding planner comes to the aid of a bodybuilder bride, Anthony puts together a Spice Girls tribute act, and a couple plan to open a British chip shop.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A Yorkshire landlord has to call in eviction specialists to remove tenants from the house he inherited from his grandparents. Music entrepreneur Donovan has not received rent from one of his tenants for seven months, so the case ends up in court.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A retired secretary has to visit her tenant in prison to retake possession of her buy-to-let flat. A Manchester mother applies to the housing charity Shelter for help because she is convinced the property she is renting is making her children ill.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.sub-title: Home Is Where the Heart Is.
programme.desc: Carol and Trevor Gilmour hoped to renovate a barn and turn it into their dream home, but have been forced to live in a caravan during a long-running dispute with their neighbour over the property's front garden. Plus, a young couple gather shocking footage of the constant harassment they endured, and a farmer is suspected of killing a family's dogs.(n)

programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A Devon woman finds herself spending a night in the cells after a dispute with a neighbour who just happens to be a policeman, while a York man gets an unexpected soaking after an argument with the person next door. In Glasgow, an upset over an invitation leads to a hospital visit and a criminal record for one unhappy homeowner.(n)

programme.title: The Story of
programme.desc: Documentary charting the remarkable career trajectory of Adele Adkins, the pop and soul singer who rose from humble beginnings in Tottenham to become one of the biggest stars of the modern music industry. Now popular enough to warrant going by her forename only, Adele's interest in music was encouraged by her mother from an early age. Winning a place at the Brit School in Croydon, Adele first shot into the public eye when her friend uploaded a demo to MySpace in 2006, and by the time she graduated, the singer had already secured a record deal. What followed were three hugely successful albums, 19, 21 and 25, each of which surpassed the last in terms of critical acclaim and sales figures. Adele also scored an Oscar in 2013 for her song Skyfall, which featured as the theme of the James Bond film of the same name.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Championship
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents highlights from the latest games in the Championship, which included Sheffield Wednesday v Queens Park Rangers at Hillsborough, Leeds United v Preston North End at Elland Road and Hull City v Burton Albion at the KCOM Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: Goals from the weekend's games in Leagues One and Two, which included Blackburn Rovers v Doncaster Rovers at Ewood Park, Plymouth Argyle v Charlton Athletic at Home Park and Grimsby Town v Coventry City at Blundell Park.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Highlights from Friday, including the celebrity contestants' reactions to the next eviction, which saw another of the famous residents receive their marching orders. Plus, games, gossip and diary room confessions.(n)

programme.title: Lip Sync Battle UK
programme.sub-title: Lip Sync Battle UK: Manford v Keegan.
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and actress Michelle Keegan go head to head lip-synching to a hit song, complete with dance moves, facial expressions and costumes. Presented by former Spice Girl Melanie Brown and rapper Professor Green.(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widow making ends meet as a psychic (Elizabeth Reaser) is stunned when she obtains a Ouija board that actually enables her to talk to the dead. While it's great for her business, the board also allows a vengeful ghost to possess her nine-year-old daughter (Lulu Wilson). Directed by Mike Flanagan, this horror sequel co-stars Annalise Basso, Henry Thomas, and Doug Jones(n)

programme.title: Sudden Impact
programme.desc: Magnum 44 thriller. In his fourth screen outing as 'Dirty' Harry Callahan, Clint Eastwood tracks down a rape victim who is killing off the men responsible(n)

programme.title: Half Past Dead
programme.desc: After infiltrating a crime syndicate, an undercover FBI agent lands in prison, where he tries to thwart a plot to recover stolen gold(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Multimillion-selling recording artist Britney Spears makes the transition to the big screen with this teen road trip romantic comedy, co-produced by the film branch of the entity that first brought her pop stardom, MTV. Crossroads casts Spears as Lucy, the shy valedictorian of her high school graduating class. On the night of their prom, Lucy and her once-close childhood friends -- the prim and proper Kit (Zoe Saldana) and the tomboyish, five-months-pregnant Mimi (Taryn Manning) -- reunite to dig up a time capsule they buried together as little girls. Mimi's about to make good on her childhood dreams; she's leaving their small Southern town for hopes of fame and fortune in Los Angeles. Though Lucy and Kit are reluctant to join her, they decide to tag along at the last minute, agreeing to be chauffeured by Mimi's just-out-of-jail friend, Ben (Anson Mount). As they trek across the country, plagued by car problems, unsanitary motels, and petty bickering, the three friends reveal meaningful secrets to each other, and Lucy begins to realize that the handsome, reticent Ben might just be the guy for her(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Classic sidesplittingly funny comedy stars John Belushi as the head of the delinquent Delta House fraternity that the dean of Faber College plans to rid his campus of(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Daring adventurer Rick returns to Egypt for a second crack at evil high priest Imhotep. But this time, the devious shaman has enlisted the diabolical services of the Scorpion King and his army of a thousand jackal warriors(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: Master Of The Shadowless Kick: Wong Kei-ying
The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman racked up an Oscar reprising his role from "The Hustler", a pool shark who takes a hotshot under his wing(n)

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: An Afghanistan War veteran living in London seeks revenge against his pregnant girlfriend's killer by assuming an upper-class identity and using his connections in the Chinese mob(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: After his 13-year-old sister is abducted by sex traffickers, a determined Mexican teen travels from the barrios of Mexico City to a run-down stash house in New Jersey in a desperate attempt to rescue the frightened girl before she is swallowed whole by one of the criminal underworld's darkest secrets. Jorge's (Cesar Ramos) adolescent sister, Adriana (Paulina Gaitan), has been kidnapped and thrust into a lucrative underground trade in which young girls are bought and sold to the highest bidder. Now, as the terrified youngster is herded through a complex network of underground tunnels leading into the United States, her only ally is a Polish woman named Veronica (Alicja Bachleda), who has been tricked into the trade by the same nefarious gang. After circumventing immigration officers and eventually working his way across the border, the desperate Jorge comes into contact with a Texas lawman named Ray (Kevin Kline), whose own devastating personal loss to sex traffickers causes him to join the search for Adriana. In the dark days that follow, Jorge and Ray form a close bond as they witness the horrors of a secret Internet sex slave auction and discover just how far the depths of human depravity can plunge while attempting to maintain hope that brother and sister will one day be reunited. In the world of international sex trafficking, however, innocent victims disappear without a trace every day and few who fall prey to these reprehensible predators are ever seen again(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: This lively black comedy turns the zombie movie on its undead head. Billy Connolly is a howl as a zombie who's been domesticated to do work around a suburban couple's home, where he befriends their young son. All goes well until his electrified collar goes on the fritz and he reverts to his bloodthirsty, flesh-eating ways(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: In Alexander Payne's bittersweet comedy, two buddies, Miles and Jack, embark on Jack's stag week, a tasting trip around California's wine country, with oenophile Miles leading the way. Miles may be a wine expert but he's also a bitter divorcee, depressed and in love with a waitress, Maya, whose presence always leaves him tongue-tied. Jack is a faded actor who can't quite resign himself to marriage when there are still obtainable women in the world, married or not, and when he meets Stephanie at a tasting, he swears Miles to secrecy about the wedding. And so the foursome continue their trip... Alexander Payne's Oscar and BAFTA-winning road trip is a classic of friendship and crisis, with four outstanding leads(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks delivers an outstanding performance in this excellent Oscar winning Drama. Chuck Noland is a Fed-Ex manager who demands that everything must be on time and travels the world to make sure punctuality is on top of everything else. He has a girlfriend, Kelly, with whom he is deeply in love with and family he hardly sees. When work intrudes on Christmas Eve, Chuck has a quick gift exchange in the car and kisses Kelly goodbye. He boards a delivery plane going overseas which gets caught in a horrendous storm and crashes into the Pacific. The sole survivor Chuck washes up on a remote island along with several Fed-Ex packages that he must use for supplies. With limited luxury, he adapts to the island over the course of 1,500 nights(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this film adaptation of the popular video-game series(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Eerie saga about a rare-book buyer who becomes a target of unknown forces when he's asked to find a volume about the Devil(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: Following the life of cocaine-trafficking pioneer George Jung in a way that recalls Martin Scorsese's Casino, Blow recounts the man's days from his 1950s childhood in Boston to his downfall in the 1980s. George (played by Johnny Depp) begins his life as the son of Fred (Ray Liotta), an earnest breadwinner, and Ermine (Rachel Griffiths), who frequently walks out on them in pursuit of a more fulfilling life. When George moves west to California in the late '60s, accompanied by best pal Tuna (Ethan Suplee), he becomes an entrepreneur in the marijuana business, which soon spreads to the East Coast as well, with girlfriend Barbara (Franka Potente) smuggling the product during her stewardess shifts. George is arrested in 1972 -- at which time Barbara dies of cancer -- but George finds a new ally in Diego (Jordi Molla), who proposes the idea that he become the American conduit for Colombian kingpin Pablo Escobar (Cliff Curtis). George flourishes in the heyday of the disco era, and falls for Mirtha (Penelope Cruz), a self-serving bombshell who eventually has a daughter with him. Trouble escalates as the FBI threatens to bring George and his crew down, while he desperately tries to be a stable parent to his young offspring. Blow also features Paul Reubens and Max Perlich in featured roles(n)

programme.title: From Hell
programme.desc: Johnny Depp stars in this intense psychological spin on the horrific legend of Jack the Ripper(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning Exorcist director William Friedkin scuttles deep into the darkest recesses of the traumatized human psyche with this tale of a lonely bartender haunted by the long-ago disappearance of her young son, and the paranoia that emerges when she enters into a tentative relationship with a deeply disturbed drifter. Adapted from the off-Broadway play by Tracy Letts, Bug centers on Agnes (Ashley Judd), who tends bar alongside pal R.C. (Lynn Collins), and has recently moved into a shoddy roadside motel in hopes of avoiding her menacing and recently paroled ex-husband, Jerry (Harry Connick Jr.). Upon making the acquaintance of subdued former soldier Peter (Michael Shannon, repeating his stage role), a veteran of the first Gulf War, Agnes finally senses that things are looking up. Quietly charming despite his melancholy aura, Peter soon reveals to Agnes that he contracted a "bug" while serving in the Middle East, and that it may have been deliberately administered as part of a secret military medical experiment. Convinced that the microscopic insects are quickly multiplying just under the surface of his skin and that they have now infected Agnes as well, Peter soon descends into a psychotic rage as he resorts to increasingly desperate measures to purge himself of the offending subdermal arthropods(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Kane gives a killer performance as a deranged, hulking psychopath who terrorizes eight teens working to rehab a decrepit hotel. It's no-holds-barred mayhem as the murderer employs a variety of different weapons and instruments to dispatch his victims. Directed by Gregory Dark. WWE head Vince McMahon serves as executive producer. Steven Vidler, Christina Vidal, Michael J. Pagan, Samantha Noble, Cecily Polson, Luke Pegler, Penny McNamee, Craig Horner(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widow making ends meet as a psychic (Elizabeth Reaser) is stunned when she obtains a Ouija board that actually enables her to talk to the dead. While it's great for her business, the board also allows a vengeful ghost to possess her nine-year-old daughter (Lulu Wilson). Directed by Mike Flanagan, this horror sequel co-stars Annalise Basso, Henry Thomas, and Doug Jones(n)

programme.desc: Magnum 44 thriller. In his fourth screen outing as 'Dirty' Harry Callahan, Clint Eastwood tracks down a rape victim who is killing off the men responsible(n)

James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Keanu

The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman racked up an Oscar reprising his role from "The Hustler", a pool shark who takes a hotshot under his wing(n)

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: An Afghanistan War veteran living in London seeks revenge against his pregnant girlfriend's killer by assuming an upper-class identity and using his connections in the Chinese mob(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: After his 13-year-old sister is abducted by sex traffickers, a determined Mexican teen travels from the barrios of Mexico City to a run-down stash house in New Jersey in a desperate attempt to rescue the frightened girl before she is swallowed whole by one of the criminal underworld's darkest secrets. Jorge's (Cesar Ramos) adolescent sister, Adriana (Paulina Gaitan), has been kidnapped and thrust into a lucrative underground trade in which young girls are bought and sold to the highest bidder. Now, as the terrified youngster is herded through a complex network of underground tunnels leading into the United States, her only ally is a Polish woman named Veronica (Alicja Bachleda), who has been tricked into the trade by the same nefarious gang. After circumventing immigration officers and eventually working his way across the border, the desperate Jorge comes into contact with a Texas lawman named Ray (Kevin Kline), whose own devastating personal loss to sex traffickers causes him to join the search for Adriana. In the dark days that follow, Jorge and Ray form a close bond as they witness the horrors of a secret Internet sex slave auction and discover just how far the depths of human depravity can plunge while attempting to maintain hope that brother and sister will one day be reunited. In the world of international sex trafficking, however, innocent victims disappear without a trace every day and few who fall prey to these reprehensible predators are ever seen again(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: This lively black comedy turns the zombie movie on its undead head. Billy Connolly is a howl as a zombie who's been domesticated to do work around a suburban couple's home, where he befriends their young son. All goes well until his electrified collar goes on the fritz and he reverts to his bloodthirsty, flesh-eating ways(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: In Alexander Payne's bittersweet comedy, two buddies, Miles and Jack, embark on Jack's stag week, a tasting trip around California's wine country, with oenophile Miles leading the way. Miles may be a wine expert but he's also a bitter divorcee, depressed and in love with a waitress, Maya, whose presence always leaves him tongue-tied. Jack is a faded actor who can't quite resign himself to marriage when there are still obtainable women in the world, married or not, and when he meets Stephanie at a tasting, he swears Miles to secrecy about the wedding. And so the foursome continue their trip... Alexander Payne's Oscar and BAFTA-winning road trip is a classic of friendship and crisis, with four outstanding leads(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks delivers an outstanding performance in this excellent Oscar winning Drama. Chuck Noland is a Fed-Ex manager who demands that everything must be on time and travels the world to make sure punctuality is on top of everything else. He has a girlfriend, Kelly, with whom he is deeply in love with and family he hardly sees. When work intrudes on Christmas Eve, Chuck has a quick gift exchange in the car and kisses Kelly goodbye. He boards a delivery plane going overseas which gets caught in a horrendous storm and crashes into the Pacific. The sole survivor Chuck washes up on a remote island along with several Fed-Ex packages that he must use for supplies. With limited luxury, he adapts to the island over the course of 1,500 nights(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: Following the life of cocaine-trafficking pioneer George Jung in a way that recalls Martin Scorsese's Casino, Blow recounts the man's days from his 1950s childhood in Boston to his downfall in the 1980s. George (played by Johnny Depp) begins his life as the son of Fred (Ray Liotta), an earnest breadwinner, and Ermine (Rachel Griffiths), who frequently walks out on them in pursuit of a more fulfilling life. When George moves west to California in the late '60s, accompanied by best pal Tuna (Ethan Suplee), he becomes an entrepreneur in the marijuana business, which soon spreads to the East Coast as well, with girlfriend Barbara (Franka Potente) smuggling the product during her stewardess shifts. George is arrested in 1972 -- at which time Barbara dies of cancer -- but George finds a new ally in Diego (Jordi Molla), who proposes the idea that he become the American conduit for Colombian kingpin Pablo Escobar (Cliff Curtis). George flourishes in the heyday of the disco era, and falls for Mirtha (Penelope Cruz), a self-serving bombshell who eventually has a daughter with him. Trouble escalates as the FBI threatens to bring George and his crew down, while he desperately tries to be a stable parent to his young offspring. Blow also features Paul Reubens and Max Perlich in featured roles(n)

programme.desc: In this comedy from the producing team behind Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo, David Spade portrays Joe Dirt, a janitor with a mullet hairdo who currently works as a janitor in the rural West Coast. An on-air radio deejay (Dennis Miller) recounts his life story as a white-trash reject who, at age eight, was abandoned by his mean-spirited birth parents (Roseanne and Gary Busey) at the Grand Canyon. Years later, Joe Dirt attempts to seek out his birth parents and discover the mystery of why they dismissed him. Going from one misadventure to another, Joe's life unfolds on the radio show where his life story becomes a sensation to the locals. programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Crime Family. The Mob is demystified in the A&E program American Justice: Crime Family. Host Bill Kurtis takes the viewer into the heart of the New York underworld to examine the long arms of the Genovese family. Started when Vito Genovese worked under Lucky Luciano, the notorious family has a firm grip on syndicated crime. A&E presents rare footage of the gangster clan and its shady leaders. For years, police have pursued the Genovese, but they remain frustratingly immune to arrest. Hear from the prosecutors who have made their capture a full-time job and the historians who will explain why the Genovese will never die(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story
programme.desc: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story. This documentary, part of the American Justice series from A&E, examines the Texas death penalty case of Karla Faye Walker. Narrated by American Justice host and producer Bill Kurtis, this episode goes inside the investigation of the two murders that Walker and her boyfriend Daniel Ryan Garrett committed. The trial of Walker is shown through exclusive footage. After the conviction, American Justice follows her through her daily life, showing her prison surroundings and talking with her about her crimes. Sentenced to death, while Walker was waiting to be executed, she became a born-again Christian. Her lawyers used this transformation as leverage to try to get her death sentence reduced to life in prison. Their attempts were unsuccessful and Walker was killed by lethal injection in February 1998. American Justice also shows interviews with lawyers and law enforcement professionals who knew Walker(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Crime Family. The Mob is demystified in the A&E program American Justice: Crime Family. Host Bill Kurtis takes the viewer into the heart of the New York underworld to examine the long arms of the Genovese family. Started when Vito Genovese worked under Lucky Luciano, the notorious family has a firm grip on syndicated crime. A&E presents rare footage of the gangster clan and its shady leaders. For years, police have pursued the Genovese, but they remain frustratingly immune to arrest. Hear from the prosecutors who have made their capture a full-time job and the historians who will explain why the Genovese will never die(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story
programme.desc: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story. This documentary, part of the American Justice series from A&E, examines the Texas death penalty case of Karla Faye Walker. Narrated by American Justice host and producer Bill Kurtis, this episode goes inside the investigation of the two murders that Walker and her boyfriend Daniel Ryan Garrett committed. The trial of Walker is shown through exclusive footage. After the conviction, American Justice follows her through her daily life, showing her prison surroundings and talking with her about her crimes. Sentenced to death, while Walker was waiting to be executed, she became a born-again Christian. Her lawyers used this transformation as leverage to try to get her death sentence reduced to life in prison. Their attempts were unsuccessful and Walker was killed by lethal injection in February 1998. American Justice also shows interviews with lawyers and law enforcement professionals who knew Walker(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Oakamoor, Staffordshire: In Search of a Medieval Blast Furnace.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team return to a cottage in Oakamoor, Staffordshire, where remains of a blast furnace were unearthed during the programme's 2003 Big Dig. Having already established that iron smelting was going on in the Elizabethan age, they set out to prove the quiet rural valley had been a centre of heavy industry since the Middle Ages.(n)

programme.title: Industrial Revelations
programme.desc: Mark Williams reveals how the Leeds and Liverpool Canal turned two rival counties into hotbeds of activity, bringing wealth to mill owners during the Industrial Revolution.(n)

programme.title: Industrial Revelations
programme.desc: How Thomas Telford and the Darby family used iron to create new transport routes during the Industrial Revolution. Presented by Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Weapons of War
programme.desc: The role of the U-boat in Germany's efforts to win the Second World War, including footage of Europe's only surviving vessel of its type.(n)

programme.title: Hitler's Generals
programme.desc: Profile of First World War fighter ace and director-general of equipment for the Luftwaffe Ernst Udet, who committed suicide in 1941.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: South Carlton, Lincolnshire: Saxon Burials on the Ridge.
programme.desc: Alerted to the presence of an Anglo-Saxon cemetery in a field in South Carlton, Lincolnshire, by artefacts found by amateur detectorists, the team sets out to establish its age, size and length of use. The discovery of a skeleton and twisted shield sends the excavation off in a new direction. Presented by Tony Robinson.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Loch Migdale, Sutherland: The Island in the Lake.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team try to piece together the story of prehistoric life in the Highlands. They excavate underwater to explore a mysterious island in Loch Migdale and also investigate a ritual henge monument from the Bronze Age.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: In the 1940s, Basil Brown, the man who discovered Sutton Hoo, believed he had uncovered the remains of the largest Roman villa in East Anglia. In Suffolk, Tony Robinson and the team arrive at an Ipswich suburb to see if he was right - but to find out, they have to dig up a few back gardens and patios.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team take part in a dig at 15th-century Prebendal Manor in Northamptonshire to unearth a Saxon hall alleged to have belonged to King Canute. However, they first have to rip up the floorboards of the Grade I-listed property.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Wittenham Clumps, Oxfordshire: Fertile Soils, Rich Archaeology.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits Wittenham to piece together clues to one of the most extensive Iron Age landscapes discovered in Britain. A major feature of the area is a hill fort from which vast expanses of Oxfordshire and the Thames can be seen. However, little is known about a much larger neighbouring prominence less than 150 metres away, so the team tries to uncover its secrets.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Goldcliff, Newport: Rescuing a Mesolithic Foreshore.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team battle to conserve evidence of England's first inhabitants and an ancient way of life, which was gathered from the River Severn. Flints, food remains and - most remarkably - fossilised footsteps - on the foreshore at Goldcliff, near Newport, need to be saved and recorded before the strong tide washes them away.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Oakamoor, Staffordshire: In Search of a Medieval Blast Furnace.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team return to a cottage in Oakamoor, Staffordshire, where remains of a blast furnace were unearthed during the programme's 2003 Big Dig. Having already established that iron smelting was going on in the Elizabethan age, they set out to prove the quiet rural valley had been a centre of heavy industry since the Middle Ages.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Green Island, Dorset: The Island of Finds.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Green Island in the centre of Poole Harbour, Dorset, which is now a haven for weekend sailors having been arguably the country's busiest and most important port during the Iron Age. Over the course of three days, the team tries to establish whether the area was once the site of an early form of mass production.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Syndale, Kent: The Fort That Wasn't There.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team have three days to discover whether the Syndale Park Motel in Kent is built on the site of Britain's first Roman fort after the grounds yielded ditches, ramparts, coins and pottery. If so, it could prove the existence of a supply line established when the invading Roman army swept toward London.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A search for the remains of Roxburgh, formerly one of Scotland's great medieval centres, which eventually fell into decline and disappeared in the 16th century. With only a ruined castle as a clue to the lost city's layout, Phil Harding and his army of diggers have just three days to peel back the layers of history and identify the royal seat of David I, which was burnt to the ground in 1460. Presented by Tony Robinson.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Cranborne Chase, Dorset: Brimming with Remains.
programme.desc: The team explores the many delights of Dorset farmer Simon Meadon's fields. Crammed with finds, from a possible Romano-British villa to a Bronze Age boundary ditch, the site is a complex one, and the work is increased by the important discovery of a number of burials. With just three days to unpick thousands of years of history, the experts struggle to unearth what made the area so special.(n)

programme.title: Battlefield
programme.sub-title: Battle for the Crimea - Part Two.

programme.title: Bring It On
programme.desc: The hard work, dedication, and personal politics behind "rah rah rah!" and "sis boom bah!" go under the microscope in this engaging teen comedy. Torrance Shipman (Kirsten Dunst) discovers that being captain of her San Diego high school's six-time championship-winning cheerleading squad is more complicated than she had imagined. Torrance's parents want her to spend more time on her homework, her boyfriend wants her to spend more time with him, and she learns that the squad's former captain stole some of their best routines from other teams -- and that Isis (Gabrielle Union), captain of a top squad at a crosstown, inner-city high school, plans to fight back this year. To make things worse, when one of the cheerleaders is injured, Torrance is forced to replace her with Missy (Eliza Dushku), a cynical new kid who is involved only because the school doesn't offer gymnastics. In the midst of this chaos, with the national championship around the corner, Torrance couldn't have picked a worse time to fall in love with Cliff (Jesse Bradford), a classmate who cares a lot more about punk rock than school spirit. Dunst trained with a cheerleading squad for her role, though a double performed the more complicated stunts(n)

programme.title: Bring It On
programme.desc: The hard work, dedication, and personal politics behind "rah rah rah!" and "sis boom bah!" go under the microscope in this engaging teen comedy. Torrance Shipman (Kirsten Dunst) discovers that being captain of her San Diego high school's six-time championship-winning cheerleading squad is more complicated than she had imagined. Torrance's parents want her to spend more time on her homework, her boyfriend wants her to spend more time with him, and she learns that the squad's former captain stole some of their best routines from other teams -- and that Isis (Gabrielle Union), captain of a top squad at a crosstown, inner-city high school, plans to fight back this year. To make things worse, when one of the cheerleaders is injured, Torrance is forced to replace her with Missy (Eliza Dushku), a cynical new kid who is involved only because the school doesn't offer gymnastics. In the midst of this chaos, with the national championship around the corner, Torrance couldn't have picked a worse time to fall in love with Cliff (Jesse Bradford), a classmate who cares a lot more about punk rock than school spirit. Dunst trained with a cheerleading squad for her role, though a double performed the more complicated stunts(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Youngstown Boys. An exploration of the class and power dynamics in college sports through the interconnected journeys of one-time dynamic running back Maurice Clarett and former elite head coach Jim Tressel. Clarett and Tressel emerged from opposite sides of the tracks in Youngstown, Ohio, and then joined up for a magical season at Ohio State University in 2002 that produced the first national football championship for the school in over 30 years. Shortly after, Clarett was suspended from college football and began a downward spiral that ended with a prison term(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: In the second of two episodes examining the Indian Ocean, Paul Rose, Philippe Cousteau Jr, Dr Lucy Blue and Tooni Mahto explore the impact the ocean's tides and currents have on coastal areas. They join a group of scientists working on an experiment to predict extreme weather, and dive down to a coral colony - an environment in which they can learn about changes in the planet's climate.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Documentary breathing new life into the smilodon, the largest of all sabre-toothed cats, which found itself pitted against new enemies in the form of the giant ground sloth and terrifying birds. The programme tells the story of a male facing a harsh existence as it struggles to survive alone after being excluded from its social group.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Re-creating the freezing wastelands of the Ice Age 30,000 years ago, as worsening winter conditions force a mammoth herd to head south for the relative safety of an Alpine valley. The journey is fraught with danger as frozen bogs line the path and their every move is watched by the predatory eyes of a hungry cave lion, while a group of Neanderthals lies in ambush in preparation for the biggest hunt of the year.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall seeks out a tiger in India with the help of locals and along the way encounters another endangered creature - the gharial crocodile.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Creatures that inhabit the Gomantong cave system in Malaysia, including cockroaches, scutagera centipedes, wrinkle-lipped bats and tiger leeches.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.(n)

programme.title: Oceans

programme.title: Super Giant Animals
programme.desc: Steve Backshall travels across the world to encounter the largest animals he can find and discover the remarkable things their size enables them to do. Highlights include Steve swimming with Nile crocodiles in Botswana, dodging two-ton elephant seals in California and diving with sperm whales in the Caribbean.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Bailey narrates a documentary examining the lives of an eccentric cast of unconventional and unusual creatures that do things differently, turning this oddness to their advantage, such as the parrot that has forgotten how to fly, the bear that has turned vegetarian and a penguin that lives in the forest.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Roughly once every 40 years in the northern Kalahari Desert of Botswana an ancient waterway called the Savute channel fills and flows into the surrounding marshes. This attracts thousands of grazing animals from across the region - and also draws predators to the area. This documentary follows the fortunes of Africa's largest herd of elephants and a pride of seven lions as they come face to face in an epic fight for survival, with drought having weakened the elephants and the lions desperately hungry. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Return of the Giant Killers: Africa's Lion Kings.
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting the pride of African lions featured in Africa's Giant Killers: Natural World, which detailed a clash between drought-weakened elephants and hungry big cats in the northern stretches of the Kalahari Desert in Botswana. This follow-up rejoins the pride at the start of the rainy season, when the departure of the elephants brings a whole host of new problems for the lions. The males begin to turn against each other, and one inexperienced lioness places her cubs in mortal danger as a rival group challenges the area's resident lions. Wild fires caused by lightning devastate the landscape, and as the dust begins to settle, the pride must once again face off with the elephants or risk starvation. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary shot over the course of two years, providing an insight into work at Chengdu Research Base in central China. The programme details how workers at the sanctuary hope to breed 300 pandas as part of an ambitious conservation project, the final aim being to introduce them back into the wild and help bring the creatures back from the brink of extinction. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Mountain Lions: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The trials and tribulations of two mountain lion families as they raise their kittens in the spectacular Rocky Mountains in Wyoming. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Clever Monkeys
programme.desc: Documentary examining strikingly human-like behaviour patterns in other primates, discovering examples of simian intelligence in langurs, pygmy marmosets - which `farm' tree sap - and white-faced capuchins who tenderly nurse the victims of battle. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Bailey narrates a documentary examining the lives of an eccentric cast of unconventional and unusual creatures that do things differently, turning this oddness to their advantage, such as the parrot that has forgotten how to fly, the bear that has turned vegetarian and a penguin that lives in the forest.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Roughly once every 40 years in the northern Kalahari Desert of Botswana an ancient waterway called the Savute channel fills and flows into the surrounding marshes. This attracts thousands of grazing animals from across the region - and also draws predators to the area. This documentary follows the fortunes of Africa's largest herd of elephants and a pride of seven lions as they come face to face in an epic fight for survival, with drought having weakened the elephants and the lions desperately hungry. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Return of the Giant Killers: Africa's Lion Kings.
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting the pride of African lions featured in Africa's Giant Killers: Natural World, which detailed a clash between drought-weakened elephants and hungry big cats in the northern stretches of the Kalahari Desert in Botswana. This follow-up rejoins the pride at the start of the rainy season, when the departure of the elephants brings a whole host of new problems for the lions. The males begin to turn against each other, and one inexperienced lioness places her cubs in mortal danger as a rival group challenges the area's resident lions. Wild fires caused by lightning devastate the landscape, and as the dust begins to settle, the pride must once again face off with the elephants or risk starvation. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary shot over the course of two years, providing an insight into work at Chengdu Research Base in central China. The programme details how workers at the sanctuary hope to breed 300 pandas as part of an ambitious conservation project, the final aim being to introduce them back into the wild and help bring the creatures back from the brink of extinction. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Mountain Lions: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The trials and tribulations of two mountain lion families as they raise their kittens in the spectacular Rocky Mountains in Wyoming. David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Up in Smoke
programme.desc: When a series of mishaps result in their deportation to Mexico, Cheech and Chong unintentionally agree to smuggle a van made entirely out of marijuana across the border(n)

programme.title: Moonraker
programme.desc: British agent James Bond investigates the disappearance of an Anglo-American space shuttle which has fallen into the hands of a billionaire megalomaniac intent on world domination. Along the way, Bond has to contend with giant, steel-toothed hitman Jaws before stowing away on a flight to a space station being used as a colony to breed a genetically pure race(n)

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: Casper Van Dien, Dina Meyer, Denise Richards, Jake Busey, Neil Patrick Harris, Clancy Brown. Science fiction adventure in which a futuristic, militarised Earth is threatened by regiments of giant insects from outer space. When an idealistic teenager enlists in the army in order to become a citizen, he is put through a brutal training programme to prepare him for the horrors of war. Sent to the distant planet Klendathu, he and his fellow troopers fight the deadly enemy force(n)

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: Two spoilt middle-aged men who still live at home become stepbrothers when their parents marry. Forced to share a bedroom and look for jobs together, the pair eventually forge a friendship. But can the family's domestic situation ever be harmonious?(n)

programme.title: Vertical Limit
programme.desc: A photographer who witnessed his famous mountaineer father's death as a child must face his fears and rescue his sister who is trapped on K2 at 26,000 feet. Feeling responsible for his father's fatal accident, the young man had given up climbing but when his sister and her team become trapped after an avalanche, he must enlist the help of experts in order to save the group(n)

programme.title: Ever After
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore stars in this lively costume romance that breathes new life into the traditional story of the beautiful Cinderella. In 16th century Europe, Danielle endures an unhappy life with her mean stepmother but finds she has a chance for happiness through an encounter with the handsome Prince Henry. However, with so much separating the lowly Danielle from her Prince, it seems that she doesn't stand a chance of living happily ever after(n)

programme.title: Moonraker
programme.desc: British agent James Bond investigates the disappearance of an Anglo-American space shuttle which has fallen into the hands of a billionaire megalomaniac intent on world domination. Along the way, Bond has to contend with giant, steel-toothed hitman Jaws before stowing away on a flight to a space station being used as a colony to breed a genetically pure race(n)

programme.title: Dr. No
programme.desc: Ian Fleming's suave secret agent 007 makes his big-screen debut in this cheeky and fast-paced spy thriller, the first of a long series of James Bond films. Dr. No is the film that made former body-builder Sean Connery a star. Actress Ursula Andress also made a splash as the bikini-clad seductress who rises from the sea to use Bond to get revenge upon Dr. No. Bond himself is also after No, who, according to Bond's boss M, is about to financially ruin the United States. Bond's search for the crazed extortionist leads him to Jamaica and gets him into a variety of potentially dangerous scrapes, that while nowhere near as elaborate as those in subsequent Bond films, are still exciting(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: Guts. With Jupiter's draft status up in the air, Reggie has Missy tutor him, and it proves more difficult than she imagined. Cam and Allison's romance intensifies; and Reggie's business prospects expand(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: Starts and Stops. In the Season 2 finale, Reggie second-guesses himself about representing Jupiter, but Cam is sure he's made an excellent decision about Allison. Meanshile, a crisis rocks the family(n)

programme.title: Eddie Murphy: Raw
programme.desc: Outrageous comic Eddie Murphy makes a triumphant return to the stand-up comedy stage, sharing his unique, raunchy humour with his fans at its unexpurgated best(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: Action comedy sequel to the box-office smash. Hard-nosed cop Axel Foley is called back to LA to help his West Coast colleagues solve the 'Alphabet Crimes', and is soon on the trail of an illegal arms dealer and his hit woman(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: Axel Foley, while investigating a car theft ring, comes across the same men who shot his boss(n)

programme.title: Step Up 2: The Streets
programme.desc: Director Jon M. Chu takes the helm for this Step Up sequel set at the Maryland School for the Arts and following the journey of a rebellious street dancer who struggles to fit in at the prestigious school. Andie (Briana Evigan) may show great promise as a dancer, but she just can't seem to let go of her old life and get a fresh start. With Baltimore's hottest underground dance contest looming on the horizon, Andie joins forces with top dancer Chase (Robert Hoffman) while simultaneously helping to sharpen the skills of her outcast classmates. Perhaps if Andie, Chase, and their talented team of misfit dancers can earn the top slot at The Streets, the troubled new arrival can finally make her dreams a reality while also letting go of the past, and bounding confidently forward into the future(n)

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic sci-fi tale about two ordinary Midwesterners who are transformed by extraordinary chance meetings with visitors from outer space. Vilmos Zsigmond won an Oscar for his dazzling cinematography(n)

programme.title: Top Secret!
programme.desc: Another parody from the creators of "Airplane!" this time spoofing WWII spy flicks and 1950s rock-and-roll romps. Val Kilmer. Cedric: Omar Sharif. Hillary: Lucy Gutteridge. Nigel: Christopher Villiers. Bookstore Owner: Peter Cushing. Streck: Jeremy Kemp(n)

programme.title: From Russia with Love
programme.desc: From Russia With Love is the second -- and arguably the best -- James Bond thriller, featuring a tense story that has Agent 007 (Sean Connery) battling Russian spies -- including Lotte Lenya as Rosa Klebb -- and the evil SPECTRE organization, as he searches for a top-secret Russian decoding machine. Though there are many gadgets, the film is the least gimmicky of all the Bond movies, and is powered by several excellent action set pieces, most notably Connery's fight with arch-villain Robert Shaw on a passenger train(n)

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Adaptation of Tom Clancy's novel, with ex-CIA agent Jack Ryan and his family the targets of a terrorist(n)

programme.title: About Last Night
programme.desc: David Mamet's play +Sexual Perversity in Chicago was adapted for the big screen by fellow Chicago citizen Tim Kazurinsky and became About Last Night... The film stars Rob Lowe as Danny and Demi Moore as Debbie. The pair meet and engage in a torrid sexual relationship, but then slowly negotiate if there is anything more between them. Lowe seeks advice from his loudmouthed friend Bernie (Chicago native James Belushi), whose offers little more than outrageous tales of his randy exploits. Debbie confides in her best friend Joan (Elizabeth Perkins), a bitter, single kindergarten teacher who has lost any hope of finding the right person on the dating scene. Although Danny and Debbie talk, they have trouble communicating. The film ends on a coda that suggests the pair are still unsure as to where their relationship may be headed(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: Mel Brooks' classic sci-fi parody, starring Mel himself, Bill Pullman, Rick Moranis, John Candy and Joan Rivers. Packed full of more hilarious in-jokes than you can shake a lightsabre at(n)

programme.title: Mad Max
programme.desc: Futuristic action drama in which highway cops battle predatory motorcyclists(n)

programme.title: Goldfinger
programme.desc: Classic spy thriller. Secret agent James Bond dodges bullets and bowler hats as he investigates the evil empire of Auric Goldfinger, a ruthless and dangerous man with a penchant for gold bullion. Featuring a bevy of Bond beauties, memorable villains, a vast array of gadgetry and a spectacular finale in the vaults of Fort Knox(n)

programme.title: Boys of Abu Ghraib
programme.desc: A young Army Reserve enlistee grows deeply disillusioned after becoming a prison guard at Abu Ghraib, where his commanding officer coerces him into using intense interrogation techniques on a terrified detainee who appears to have committed no crime. Before long, the soldier who joined the military to defend his country begins to unravel due to the inhuman treatment he witnesses on a daily basis(n)

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A low-level CIA worker returns from lunch to find all his colleagues have been assassinated and goes on the run as he tries to discover who ordered the killings. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Leviathan
programme.desc: In George Cosmatos' sci-fi thriller, a team of oceanographers discovers a sunken Soviet submarine housing the murderous product of a genetic experiment gone horribly wrong(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: Star-studded WWII classic, inspired by real characters and events. In the supposedly escape-proof Stalag Luft III, the Allied escape committee devise a daring plan to liberate hundreds of Allied POWs into occupied territory. Hiding civilian clothing, forged documents and three tunnels from the German guards is difficult enough, but there is also the small matter of tons of soil to dispose of. Steve McQueen's famous leap over the barbed wire on a motorcycle while being pursued by Nazi troops is one of the stand-out moments in cinema history(n)

programme.title: The Towering Inferno
programme.desc: Doug Roberts, Architect, returns from a long vacation to find work nearly completed on his skyscraper. But a fire breaks out in the building and the fire department must fight to save it(n)

programme.title: The Abyss
programme.desc: A civilian deep-sea diving crew heads underwater in search of a nuclear submarine, but its members soon realise they are not alone(n)

programme.title: Gunmen
programme.desc: This film opens with a big fat close-up of a sweaty prisoner with a fly (on a string) crawling on his face. The prisoner quickly pops the fly in his mouth and spits it out. Then he leeringly laughs about it to the prisoner next door. Nope. This is not a bad undiscovered Sergio Leone spaghetti western. Rather it is the opening shot Deran Sarafin's Gunmen -- a brainless action film without an original thought in its head. Christopher Lambert is the fly-eater, a man named Dani Servigo, the brother of a dead smuggler and a prisoner in a South American jail, who holds the secret to the whereabouts of $400,000 in stolen drug money. The walls of the prison explode, and Cole Parker (Mario Van Pebbles) makes his entrance. Cole is a mercenary working with the DEA who is in this South American hellhole to mop up the drug traders and to avenge his father's death at the hands of the drug traders. He wants Dani to lead him to the gold. In this love-hate buddy film, the two thrown-together friends/enemies race through the Amazon jungle with ruthless assassins in pursuit, as they all gravitate towards the secret stash of money(n)

programme.desc: A young cop is assigned to the precinct in Queens where he grew up, and he finds his life threatened when he investigates a police cover-up involving the unsolved murders of two boys(n)

programme.desc: The team suspects foul play when a seaman who was set to testify before a grand jury dies before he can make his court appearance. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A deep-sea diver is murdered on the job, and his co-workers all become suspects. programme.title: Los piratas que no hacen nada
Mike & Molly
programme.desc: Molly's Birthday. It's Molly's birthday and she doesn't want to make a big deal of things or get a big present, but she does have a wishlist of favours she'd like, e.g., have Mike make her breakfast in bed, etc. Meanwhile, Victoria invites her pot dealer to stay at the house while his house is being fumigated for termites. He's a nice enough guy but Molly gets frustrated because he's taking up space and interfering with her birthday. The real trouble begins when Mike accidently ingests some pot-infused ice cream and wanders off through the neighbourhood. As Molly and Victoria search for Mike, Molly has a talk with Victoria about how she needs to start cleaning up her act and get real about her life (opening the door to Victoria growing up a little.) Also, Carl has a new apartment but he's lonely. He invites over Samuel and does everything he can to prevent Samuel from leaving(n)

Adventure, starring Liam Neeson, Frank Grillo and Dermot Mulroney.(n)

programme.title: Silver Linings Playbook

Romantic comedy drama, starring an Oscar-winning Jennifer Lawrence, with Bradley Cooper and Robert De Niro.(n)

programme.title: Courage Mountain

programme.title: Dr Dolittle
programme.desc: A doctor is stunned to discover he can talk to animals, and it is not long before his home and surgery are taken over by an assortment of ailing creatures in need of help. However, when the medic's odd behaviour attracts his colleagues' attention, he is forced to rely on his new-found furry friends to save him from the asylum. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Ossie Davis and Oliver Platt.(n)

programme.title: Dr Dolittle 2

Comedy sequel, starring Eddie Murphy and Kevin Pollak, with the voices of Steve Zahn, Lisa Kudrow and Isaac Hayes.(n)

Comedy sequel, starring Kyla Pratt, Kristen Wilson and John Amos.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: A misguided attempt to injure the gardener at Bayview lands Diana in hospital with a broken hip and it looks like she might miss her niece's wedding. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Diana tries her hand at being nice for a `glamorous granny' competition at Bayview. Stephanie Cole stars.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin takes on the bureaucracy of office politics when he discovers his work space has been cut in half. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: The staff of Whitbury Leisure Centre prepare to don their dinner jackets and evening gowns for a ball, but everyone has partner problems - except for married man Brittas, who seems to be getting far too close to Laura in his wife's absence. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie and Julia St John.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful.
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg climbs a tree to prove a point, but finds getting down is not as easy. Meanwhile, the police investigate the case of a runaway cooker. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin takes on the bureaucracy of office politics when he discovers his work space has been cut in half. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard has an accident and Hyacinth decides to buy a small country retreat - but her plans go awry in a most unexpected fashion. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)
