programme.desc: Part one of two. Dispirited by a wet English summer, the Larkins cross the Channel in the hope that the French way of life will have a beneficial effect on the family. David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones star.(n)

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: Flora upsets ex-theatrical trouper Dolly Love whose one and only film is shown on television. However, Dolly gets the last laugh after a letter turns up with a role in a TV commercial for her. Unfortunately, she is considered too glamorous for the part, leaving it open to someone else. Comedy, starring Peggy Mount and Pat Coombs.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: The new depot nurse moves in as the Butlers' lodger - causing problems for Arthur. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney and Michael Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Temperamental tenant Spooner, a professional wrestler, is confined to his room with a broken leg, and makes life hell for Alan and Philip by playing his radio full-blast at all hours - so naturally they challenge Rigsby to confront him. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Veteran singer and keyboard player Alan Price guest stars in this festive episode of the rural drama, as the leader of a jazz band. Travelling to Aidensfield, where they've been booked by Vernon to play at the villagers' Christmas concert, the Rio Trio offer a lift to a girl, unaware she is a single mum taking her baby home to see her parents for the holiday. However, the first the band know about the infant is when the girl disappears, leaving them to look after it. Meanwhile, as the concert gets into full swing, local barmaid Gina takes centre stage, hoping to impress all and sundry with her rendition of Winter Wonderland. Tricia Penrose, Derek Fowlds, Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons and Mark Jordon star.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: An intense competition between two rival yacht captains ends in murder - so Jessica tries to apprehend the culprit. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After reaching breaking point with being followed around by Buddy, Martin resolves to find a vet to have it put down, while Ruth finds out that Bert has been trying to make his own whisky. Clive is suspicious of Mrs Tishell and who she might be cooking meals for, Penhale makes a hash of asking Janice out, and Louisa and Martin's therapy homework results in a picnic on the beach, where they are interrupted by local vet Angela Sim - who appears to be hallucinating. Comedy drama, guest starring Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: The Street
programme.desc: Anna Friel plays a single mother who turns to prostitution to pay her debts and provide for her sons' schooling. Things seem to be going well, and when her boiler breaks, romance beckons with the arrival of a handsome plumber. However, her life turns sour when his father recognises her and warns her off his son and grand-daughter, just as she is beginning to fall in love. Also starring David Bradley and Daniel Mays.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: High-court judge Rachel Callaghan (guest star Juliet Stevenson) is critically injured after being shot in the underground car park of her apartment. When it becomes clear a hitman was responsible, the team tries to discover who hired him. As evidence mounts against the accused, the judge's health deteriorates, and Castle is faced with a choice between friendship and respect for a person's right to die. Bill Paterson, Bradley Walsh and Freema Agyeman star.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tony decodes the meaning of the ritual killings of homeless men and realises a clue to the murderer's identity has been under his nose all the time. Aware everyone has the potential to become a killer, he fails to foresee the threat to his own life from the mysterious stalker. Drama, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Two grieving widows lay rival claims to a corpse found washed up on the beach, each insisting it is the body of her missing husband. While it is obvious only one can be telling the truth, the detective finds it tricky to discern which of the women is lying - and why. Drama, guest starring Eleanor Bron, with Jack Shepherd.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect
programme.sub-title: Prime Suspect VI: The Last Witness.
programme.desc: Helen Mirren stars as no-nonsense detective Jane Tennison. A Bosnian illegal immigrant's body is found covered in horrific torture wounds, and Tennison goes against her boss's retirement suggestion to take charge of the murder squad and catch the culprit, causing tensions to rise within her team. Chief Inspector Finch suspects the death is connected to an underworld gang, but Tennison thinks otherwise - believing the case to be linked to the devastating war in the victim's home country. With Ben Miles, Barnaby Kay, Robert Pugh, Mark Strong and Tony Pritchard.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Harry invites Antarctic explorer Ernest Shackleton to give a lecture in the store, but the retail magnate's mind is elsewhere, disturbed by news of a death. Rose complains about Roddy, but Mr Selfridge is shocked by what he has to say on the matter, Grove and Doris find consolation in each other and Victor finally plucks up the courage to tell Lady Mae what he really thinks of her.(n)

programme.title: Davina McCall: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: Davina travels to the Costa Rican jungle, which is one of the wettest and most humid places on earth, but is a habitat in which animals thrive and is home to around 500,000 species. She learns about the ways in which creatures including sloths, poison dart frogs, tarantulas, tapirs, fer-de-lance vipers, common basilisks and spider monkeys have adapted to the conditions, before spending a night high up in the treetops of the rainforest - where a lightning striking directly overhead forces an abrupt change of plans.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Suzy gives Stan food from the canteen to take home - but it's stolen property. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Ruth talks her cantankerous landlord Rigsby into renting his newly vacated room to a friend of hers. Pilot episode of the classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Frances de la Tour and Don Warrington.(n)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.sub-title: What You Don't Know Can Kill You.
programme.desc: Jessica agrees to help a friend's niece prove that her fiance's death on his motorcycle was not an accident as had been supposed. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica Fletcher tackles a mystery involving a diamond, a dog and an old grudge while on holiday at a friend's lodge in the Grand Teton mountains. A surly visitor who threatened to reveal some scandalous information about her friend is found dead. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is called in to investigate the case of a deputy sheriff accused of murdering a businessman against whom he held a grudge - and soon finds there is more to it than meets the eye. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Climb the Greasy Pole - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. A seat becomes vacant on the local council when Sam Popham is taken ill, so Pop stands in the election, and Mariette returns from holiday with Charley. David Jason stars.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Butterfly in Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A radio presenter is plotting to sabotage his adopted daughter's plans to publish her first novel and kills one of his employees for trying to help her. He thinks he has the perfect alibi, claiming that the victim was murdered while they were talking to each other on the phone, and there is a tape recording to prove it - but his ruse fails to fool the dishevelled detective. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, William Shatner and Molly Hagan.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cruising
programme.desc: The captain of a cruise ship bound for the Mediterranean is less than impressed when five of his regular shipmates are replaced at the last minute. Despite their best efforts to earn his respect and an eagerness to please, the new recruits seem doomed to cause chaos whatever they do. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Liz Fraser and Kenneth Connor.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cruising
programme.desc: The captain of a cruise ship bound for the Mediterranean is less than impressed when five of his regular shipmates are replaced at the last minute. Despite their best efforts to earn his respect and an eagerness to please, the new recruits seem doomed to cause chaos whatever they do. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Liz Fraser and Kenneth Connor.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective applies his professional know-how to a fatal shooting, and soon begins to suspect that the dead man's brother-in-law may know more about the case than he is letting on - a theory borne out by forensic tests on the murder weapon. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour detective, with Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An American female bishop visiting St Gerard's College is found dead after drinking poisoned wine, and when another two killings occur, both mirroring macabre murders from Jacobean revenge tragedy, it appears the culprit is targeting candidates in the election to become vice-regent. However, when Innocent learns one of the suspects is hiding a dark secret, Lewis and Hathaway realise the motive is much more twisted. Guest starring Sian Phillips and Ronald Pickup, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(n)

programme.title: Housewife, 49
programme.desc: Bafta-winning drama based on a true story, written by and starring Victoria Wood. Downtrodden wife and mother Nella's life takes an unexpected turn for the better after she joins the Women's Voluntary Service office in Barrow-in-Furness during the Second World War. However, her new-found happiness is shattered when her son Cliff leaves to join the troops - provoking a painful confrontation with husband Will. David Threlfall and Stephanie Cole co-star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When an unpopular employee at a military psychiatric hospital is found murdered, there is no shortage of suspects, but a colleague of the man, an exiled Polish Jew, holds himself responsible for the death. Foyle is convinced there is another explanation, but his priorities shift when news of a missing boy from London reaches Hastings. Starring Michael Kitchen, Phyllida Law and Nicholas Woodeson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of prison officer Charlie Tyner, Brooks and Devlin discover he had been abusing his position and convicts in his charge. A suspect is brought to trial, but Steel and Phillips go in pursuit of a career criminal connected to Tyner and have to persuade their key witness to give evidence against a man she claims to love. Starring Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor makes a find that leads him to a basketball arena, while another bidder is not so successful and left desperate for revenge.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers head to Killeen, where Victor's anger at his bad hair day leads him to discover Civil War relics, while Jenny turns into a safecracker.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar is asked to take a diamond to Amsterdam for recutting - but crooks are determined to get their hands on it by any means necessary. Classic adventure, guest starring TP McKenna and Terence Rigby.(n)

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: The wheelchair-using cop tries to discover a weak link in the perfect alibi of a man suspected of murdering his wife. Drama, starring Raymond Burr.(n)

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: With his reputation and credibility on the line, Quincy races against the clock to confirm the skull of an apparent murder victim is that of a union leader who disappeared in mysterious circumstances two years previously. Jack Klugman stars.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur decides he wants to retire and Terry helps him get out of a deal with a dubious consortium of Masonic property developers. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 investigates a consortium building a lethal fighter plane in eastern Europe, that appears willing to kill to supress publication of the aircraft's appalling safetly record. Lynda Bellingham guest stars, with Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins.(n)

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Simon Templar investigates the murder of a journalist friend, following a trail of clues that leads to a cult obsessed with the splendour and savagery of ancient Rome. Drama, guest starring Peter Wyngarde and Ed Bishop.(n)

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: An extortionist preys on a baseball player and his family, and Ironside steps in to bring the villain to justice. Raymond Burr stars.(n)

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: Sam hands in his notice, but not before unsuccessfully trying to dissuade Quincy from investigating the sudden death of a Japanese martial arts movie star. Jack Klugman stars.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.sub-title: The Loneliness of the Long Distance Entrepreneur.
programme.desc: A sudden staffing crisis leaves Arthur with no choice but to employ his nephew Ray to help him sell cut-price cars from Brussels - his idea of entering the European market. Drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle are trained to act as bodyguards to a Middle Eastern president who is preparing to sign an important peace treaty. Meanwhile, two killers are receiving similar training to prepare them to assassinate him. As their paths cross, the CI5 operatives learn the would-be killers have some useful inside information and share more in common with them than they may have imagined.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: I'd Do Anything for Lesa (But I Won't Do That).
programme.desc: Lesa and Jerry get into a heated argument on their return from the east of the state, and Victor finds himself rushing to the local fire department.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact and Jenny discovers items that may stretch her sensibilities. Ricky and Bubba leave their comfort zone to turn a Texas river into a trading post.(n)

programme.title: World Series of Darts: Auckland
programme.desc: Stephen McIvor presents action from day one featuring the first-round matches, as eight seeded PDC players faced Oceanic qualifiers at the Trusts Arena in New Zealand. With commentary by Stuart Pyke, Rod Harrington and Glen Larmer.(n)

programme.title: Rambo: First Blood Part II
programme.desc: Incarcerated Special Forces veteran John Rambo is offered the chance for freedom by former commander Colonel Trautman if he takes up the offer to return to the jungles of Vietnam on a life-or-death mission to rescue American PoWs. During the course of the operation, he develops strong feelings for his guide, a female freedom fighter - but tragedy strikes, leaving him more determined than ever to exact a bloody and explosive revenge. Action adventure sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Julia Nickson-Soul, Steven Berkoff, George Kee Cheung, Andy Wood and Martin Kove.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.desc: CI5 enters a deadly race with the KGB to free a suspected double agent while he is in transit from prison to court, in the hope the action will flush out a mole operating inside the unit. Action adventure, starring Gordon Jackson, Lewis Collins and Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents racing from Croft, featuring action from round 11 of the Ginetta GT4 Supercup and round 15 of the F4 British Championship.(n)

programme.title: The Classic Car Show
programme.desc: Quentin Willson adds the Jensen Interceptor to his list of all-time classics, while Jodie Kidd drives a 1968 Chevy Camaro along the historic Route 66 in America. Will Best heads to the seaside to see whether the public prefer the classic Fiat 500 or its modern counterpart, Alex Riley meets a compulsive collector with 190 vehicles in his garage and Bruno Senna takes a 1970 Porsche 911 ST around the test track.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing: The Opening Show
programme.desc: A look ahead to the day's racing at Ascot, Haydock Park and Newmarket.(n)

programme.title: Silverstone Classic
programme.desc: Highlights of the 27th edition of the Silverstone Classic, the world's biggest classic motor racing festival.(n)

programme.title: BRDC Formula 3 Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the sixth round of the season at Brands Hatch, which was set to feature the 16, 17 and 18th races of the season.(n)

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of today's race meetings at Ascot, Haydock Park and Newmarket.(n)

programme.title: The Man from the Alamo
programme.desc: A soldier serving at the battle of the Alamo is sent to warn his comrades' families of the impending danger, but ends up falsely branded a deserter. He tries to clear his name with acts of heroism, including tracking down the traitor who robbed the casualties after the battle was over. Western, starring Glenn Ford and Julia Adams.(n)

programme.sub-title: World Cup Rivalries: England v Argentina.
programme.desc: A look at the football rivalry between the nations.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave gets help from his friends at a vault auction, but Mary's inexperience leaves her empty-handed.(n)

programme.title: World Series of Darts: Auckland
programme.desc: Stephen McIvor presents a chance to see day two from the Trusts Arena in New Zealand, featuring the quarter-finals. Both Michael van Gerwen and Phil Taylor were defeated at this stage last year, losing to James Wade and Adrian Lewis respectively. Reigning world champion van Gerwen is not taking part this time around, while Taylor is in his farewell season as a professional. The Power is showing no signs of slowing down, however, having recently wrapped up an incredible 16th World Matchplay title in Blackpool, overcoming van Gerwen, Raymond van Barneveld, Adrian Lewis and Peter Wright in the process. With commentary by Stuart Pyke, Rod Harrington and Glen Larmer.(n)

programme.title: Lock Up
programme.desc: A convict is transferred to a maximum security prison, where he falls foul of a sadistic warden with a grudge against him - and who abuses his position of power to make the inmate's life a misery and destroy his good relationship with the guards. Thriller, starring Sylvester Stallone, Donald Sutherland, Darlanne Fluegel and Tom Sizemore.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: As the German persecution of the Jews begins, Renard uses the annual procession of St Josse to register his disgust at the events taking place. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw, Cheryl Campbell, Jimmy Yuill, Bernd-Uwe Reppenhagen, Geoffrey Hutchings and Des McAleer.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the client's refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Prudence's society friends are rehearsing their show at Bellamy House when an air raid warning sounds, forcing everyone to shelter underground. As Richard surveys his damaged property the next day, a telegram arrives with chilling news about James.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: James discovers Sam has been stealing drugs, leading to a heated confrontation, and his day goes from bad to worse when tragic consequences result from his decision to operate on a patient despite not being qualified to carry out the procedure. Drummond makes it clear he expects Robert to hand in his resignation and Judy is in agonies of indecision over coming out as gay, but gets little sympathy from Ruth. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen, with a cameo appearance by TV presenter Judi Spiers as herself.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A seemingly open-and-shut inquiry prompted by a lost suitcase reveals a long-running family feud. Meanwhile, Nick gets involved with a security alert at the village fete. Nostalgic drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: The priest leads the townsfolk in a snub to the Germans, and Etienne incurs the Nazis' anger with a foolhardy and premature show of resistance. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick vows to resolve a dispute between neighbouring farms, while Kate tries to track down the source of a rare disease. Gina helps Greengrass locate the missing twin of an Australian - with a hefty reward as their motivation.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James is found alive but seriously injured in a French hospital, much to Sir Richard's relief. Gordon Jackson stars.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Dashing TV doctor James Da Costa sets pulses racing as he arrives to attend an interview for the post of clinical director, although he fails to impress his old teacher Jack, who doesn't relish working alongside his egotistical former star pupil. Meanwhile, a pregnant woman with a fractured pelvis is in danger of losing her baby and a teenage girl collapses with severe stomach pains due to liver failure. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Affair at the Victory Ball.
programme.desc: The sleuth is invited to attend a masquerade ball dressed as someone famous and modestly goes as himself - and finds time amid the revelry to solve the murder of aristocratic fellow guest Lord Cronshaw. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When Hastings and a reluctant Poirot attend a grouse shoot at a friend's estate, one of the hunting party is murdered. Despite suffering a severe cold, the Belgian sleuth is roused from his sickbed to solve the case. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team tries to find out who was responsible for the brutal stabbing of a fellow officer, but their dogged police work is thwarted when it is proven that their main suspect is not to blame. Meanwhile, as Chief Superintendent Anderson puts pressure on Helen to close the case, Banks becomes certain that one man is the perpetrator, but when his obsession sends him over the edge, Anderson questions if he is up to the job. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Conclusion. Officially on `gardening leave', Banks is forced to operate on the other side of the law for the first time, as he uses his years of experience to secure an all-important breakthrough in his mission to bring crime boss Steve Richards to justice. However, an unexpected turn of events pushes the grizzled DCI and his team back to square one, and Banks comes to understand a one-on-one confrontation may be his only chance to bring down Richards. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town reaches a conclusion after a multitude of twist and turns, countless red herrings and numerous suspects with shaky alibis. In the last-ever episode the truth is finally revealed as detectives Alec Hardy and Ellie Miller finally untangle the web of deceit surrounding the rape of Trish Winterman. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet voices her concerns to Dodson about Gill's drinking, hoping it can be dealt with amicably, so she's unnerved when her observations are taken more seriously than she intended. Meanwhile, just as Rachel feels like she's getting to grips with the sergeant's job, she makes a fatal error that puts Janet and Chris in danger. The body of a man who disappeared 15 years previously is found on the moors. Inquiries lead to a nearby farm, where the detectives encounter something much more sinister than they could have anticipated.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The discovery of slaves on the Pritchard farm has turned a murder inquiry into a multi-agency operation. The enormity of the case brings Dodson to Syndicate 9, keen to establish Gill's state of mind and efficacy as senior officer. Having been the driver involved in the fatal collision with Cal Pritchard, Janet is under investigation and unable to interview the man's widow Evie. Devastated by the consequences of her actions, the detective eventually finds solace in Chris's calm and kind reasoning, but when an incandescent Evie smells alcohol on Gill's breath, she has all the ammunition she needs to discredit the case and bring the DCI down.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The beleaguered barrister puts aside his domestic problems to defend a prostitute on the charge of murdering a high-profile businessman - a tricky case made all the more difficult by the discovery that she has many enemies, all of them determined to blacken her character. Drama, starring John Thaw.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James is found alive but seriously injured in a French hospital, much to Sir Richard's relief. Gordon Jackson stars.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Dashing TV doctor James Da Costa sets pulses racing as he arrives to attend an interview for the post of clinical director, although he fails to impress his old teacher Jack, who doesn't relish working alongside his egotistical former star pupil. Meanwhile, a pregnant woman with a fractured pelvis is in danger of losing her baby and a teenage girl collapses with severe stomach pains due to liver failure. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The race is on to find a suitable donor to save a dying leukaemia patient. Drama, starring Haydn Gwynne, Gary Mavers and Adrian Lukis.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . To make matters worse, he's been banned from driving, and shouldn't have been behind the wheel of a car in the first place, which understandably makes it hard for him to keep his mind on his job. Worried and distracted, he makes a grave error of judgement, and suddenly finds himself struggling to cover his tracks. Meanwhile, Sam finds herself on the receiving end of Christine's wrath over a malicious rumour. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack, with a guest appearance by Jane Danson's real-life partner Robert Beck.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister defends a British ambassador's daughter accused of murdering an Austrian journalist, and learns a harsh lesson in the realities of political and diplomatic power. Foxcott is singed by an old flame, while Matt risks his father's anger by moving into a squat. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Lena Headey, Michael Feast and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Spanish Chest.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby.

programme.title: Vera

As Vera delves into the dead woman's personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Former nanny Lavinia Seagram is found soaked in blood and it is believed she had turned to drink and drugs to commit suicide. programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: (1999) M Night Shyamalan's chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a past case he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists... Also starring Toni Collette. M,W,S,(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps prospective buyers Leslie and Helen Hodgkins from Halifax, West Yorkshire, find a second home in Lanzarote with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cape Coral in Florida, where he tries to help Tim Morris and his partner Elaine find their dream waterfront property on a budget of £300,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Wisteria House, Hampshire, where owner Jane Faulkner invites guests to her establishment. Later, the group members try their hands at milking a cow, while 25-year-old Zak causes surprises when he reveals his years of hospitality experience.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit The Living Room B&B in Bournemouth on their second night, which is co-owned by 25-year-old Zak Busby-Pelekanou. While at the establishment, Mike and Charlie have a hairy issue, and Jane and Amy encounter a spider, before getting to grips with an ambitious breakfast menu.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Valley Hotel in Anglesey, where owner Mike Lewis hopes his five-star pedigree will help him reap dividends in the competition. After a visit to a local RNLI station, guests Jane and Amy are left feeling sluggish when they spot an unwanted visitor in their room, and their criticism leaves the hosts looking for answers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: David and Elvira Barratt welcome the contestants to Barratt's at Ty'n Rhyl, Denbighshire, but the group has an unpleasant experience on arrival. The guests take part in an activity at a local cookery school where they are taught the art of preparing and cooking sheep's testicles. However, come feedback time, the hosts are left feeling distraught.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet to find out who earned the most and have it out with their rivals. Jane and Amy kick off proceedings with a gripe over David and Elvira's coffee criticism, yet are confronted themselves by Zak, who has a score to settle. Mike and Charlie of the Valley Hotel want to get to the bottom of an unwanted intruder during their stay at Wisteria House, and the ladies are challenged again regarding their cleanliness comments. Emotions run high as the cash is counted and the winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple disagree over where to spend their retirement, with husband Michael hoping to set up home in Derbyshire, where he will be able to indulge his passion for the British countryside. Conversely, his wife Susan would like to spend her time relaxing by a pool in the Spanish sun, and it is left up to Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman to help them decide where to spend their £180,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple with very different ideas of how they want to spend their retirement seek advice from Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman. While husband Tony plans on returning to the Wirral in Merseyside, his wife Karin hopes to move to southern Spain, where her sister has already settled.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Governor's Green in Portsmouth, where they search for the site of a 13th-century hospital founded by monks. Although part of the building still stands, the whereabouts of the rest of it remain shrouded in mystery - and initial evidence from the trenches makes the task even more confusing, leading to a clash between the diggers and surveyors.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit the Oxfordshire town of Burford to respond to a challenge from Professor Mick Aston. Here, they investigate the remains of a medieval hospital in the grounds of Burford Priory, where Mick also found evidence of a lost Anglo-Saxon settlement. Over three days, the team hopes to unearth the history of both the hospital and the earlier Saxon community, and the subsequent discoveries look set to redraw the historical map of the area.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck pops into the surgery with her elderly dog Wilf, and vet Scott Miller's Border terrier Betty has therapy on a water treadmill to help with rehabilitation after emergency spinal surgery.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a carpenter who wants to turn a 30-year-old double-decker bus into a luxury holiday retreat, and a couple using their life savings to design a boat hotel. He also visits a house in Oxford made from mud and straw, and builds a camping deck out of a motorway drainage pipe for his own tree-house project.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to north Cornwall to see one of his favourite Grand Designs, and discover whether Rebecca Sturrock and Gregory Kewish have been successful with their ambitious plans. Their project, to reinforce the walls of an old bungalow and put a new living space on top made entirely of cross-laminated timber, soon ran into difficulties, but now fully complete both inside and out, Kevin finds out whether this innovative house is really big enough to accommodate a growing family.(n)

programme.title: Dicte - Crime Reporter
programme.desc: The official police investigation pins the blame for two murders on Wagner, but Dicte tries to assist him in working out who the real killer is. In Danish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Registrar Ling is concerned about 23-year-old David, who has been brought to King's College Hospital after having seizures for 30 minutes and isn't responding to drugs. Ling weighs up the benefits of putting him into an induced coma to stop the attacks. Meanwhile, 49-year-old Suzette is brought in following an accident involving a cyclist, and Selin is accompanied by her best friend Maria to receive treatment for a cut.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Oceana, a restaurant in the heart of New Orleans, to try to change the fortunes of a business run by two quarrelling brothers. The chef soon discovers that the ingredients are of poor quality and could pose a health hazard, but he struggles to make his point with the owners without causing an even bigger conflict between them.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to north Cornwall to see one of his favourite Grand Designs, and discover whether Rebecca Sturrock and Gregory Kewish have been successful with their ambitious plans. Their project, to reinforce the walls of an old bungalow and put a new living space on top made entirely of cross-laminated timber, soon ran into difficulties, but now fully complete both inside and out, Kevin finds out whether this innovative house is really big enough to accommodate a growing family.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Guests Dr Christian Jessen, former Girls Aloud singer Kimberley Walsh and comedians Russell Kane and Josh Widdicombe join host Jimmy Carr in an extended edition of the irreverent panel show, in which teams captained by Jon Richardson and Sean Lock answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Short highlights from Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall's adventures at the smallholding, revealing the secrets to whipping up simple culinary treats.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Rhyl, North Wales v Almeria, Spain.
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman meet a woman from Cheshire who has inherited a sum of money and wants to invest in a holiday rental property she and her family can also use. They help her decide between Rhyl in north Wales, which is close to her home, or Almeria in Spain, where income will potentially be higher and the sunshine more frequent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps a couple who have decided to relocate, but are struggling to make up their minds about their preferred destination. Nick has his eyes on a property in the West Country, while Sarah wants them to move to the Lake Vinuela area, north of Malaga in Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple who are struggling to decide where they should relocate receive guidance. Graziella Clarke spent a year in Seville, Spain, during her time as a student, and would love to return to the city. However, her husband Robert is not so sure, and instead proposes a move to Dorset.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who spend every summer apart due to work commitments search for properties in Brighton and Cadiz. A Spanish property would allow Cheryl and Andy to spend their winters together in a warmer climate, but one of the house-hunters proves to be especially selective about their potential purchase.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In the Lakes, farmer Pip hatches a plan to prevent the problem of lost sheep, and in the Dales, cameras follow the Dent Brewery boys as they make and distribute their craft ales.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Kenny Flynn hosts the first dinner party in Liverpool. His evening has a `big kids' theme, so he prepares burger buns striped like a zebra and baby octopuses that resemble spiders. His guests are Nigerian model Cynthia Umezulike, rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson, businessman Rob Spicer and fine-dining enthusiast Jilly Pollock.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Multiple business owner Rob Spicer welcomes the diners to his home for the second party in Liverpool. He is convinced his `historical leader' theme will be a hit, but there is a shock in store as one of the guests reveals a secret about herself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Model and barrister Cynthia Umezulike hosts the third dinner party in Liverpool, and hopes her meal including tribal fish, a traditional Nigerian jeloff and an exotic fruit platter will impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson hosts the fourth dinner party in Liverpool. He rustles up sticky blackened pork and an Elvis-inspired dessert of deep fat-fried chocolate bars with home-made peanut butter and banana ice-cream, but grievances among the guests threaten to derail the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jilly Pollock hosts the fifth and final party in Liverpool, inviting her fellow contestants to a black-tie event. She prepares a selection of self-styled dishes for her diners, including figs, hot beef and berry delight, and hopes an evening of ballroom dancing will ease tensions following the previous night's arguments.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of campsite proprietors battle it out to be named best value, with the competition beginning at Amber's Bell Tent Camping in Mannington, Norfolk.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed into luxury glamping lodges by Nick and Sheila Charrington. The guests have little to complain about with the accommodation, but a revelation over dinner changes how they see things. Plus, a treasure hunt organised by the hosts sends one team on a wild goose chase.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day four is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where brother and sister Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a caravan site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site does not sit well with the campers - and the evening entertainment of a fire-eating limbo dancer leaves most of them cold.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The campers meet for the final time to find out what they thought one another's stay was worth. Amber is offended by Derek's low scoring, while he is thrown by Nick and Sheila's feedback. Russell and Jane have an axe to grind with Derek whose low scoring of their park is made worse by what they see as a personal attack on their hosting, while Nick and Sheila appear to emerge relatively unscathed.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: The royal documentary continues, charting the drama and intrigue of Prince Charles' love-life via intimate letters. In the 1970s, the Prince of Wales resolved to avoid repeating the mistakes of his great uncle, King Edward VIII, and sought advice on marriage from another great uncle - Lord Mountbatten. Taking the heir apparent under his wing, Mountbatten fashioned himself as kingmaker, and arranged a secret meeting in Paris, allowing Charles to meet his disgraced `Uncle David' in person. The prince developed a sympathetic view of the exiled king, and his example fails to stop Charles falling in love with an unsuitable woman, who ends up marrying one of her many past boyfriends. Returning to his first love, Camilla Parker Bowles - now a mother of two - stability continues to elude Charles, until pressure from all sides prompts him to turn his eye to Lady Diana Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Diana: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary featuring never-before-seen footage of Diana, Princess of Wales, recorded by her speech consultant between 1992 and 1993 as she sought to define her public persona and present her own version of events reported in the press, touching on her marriage and experience of public life. The programme also features in-depth interviews with people close to her.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Miles Jupp and Aisling Bea. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with Nick Helm, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: Unfinished Song
programme.desc: A cantankerous retiree discovers an untapped gift while wrestling with the impending death of his beloved wife in this inspirational musical drama from director Paul Andrew Williams. Arthur (Terence Stamp) has shared a fruitful and enduring marriage with his wife Marion (Vanessa Redgrave) when he receives the devastating news that their days together are numbered. But while Marion's condition might be terminal, she chooses to take the diagnosis in stride, doing her best to cherish what remaining time she has with her husband. Meanwhile, Arthur's already dour attitude grows increasingly grim with each passing day. When the senior's choir that Marion sings in shows up at their window one stormy morning to serenade them with Stevie Wonder's "You Are the Sunshine of My Life," Arthur completely loses his cool and snaps at the well-intentioned crooners. His outlook worsens right alongside Marion's health, but when she asks him to be her substitute in the choir, he agrees in an attempt to make her smile. Little does Arthur realize that choir director Elizabeth (Gemma Arterton) favors teaching the group such nontraditional tunes as Motörhead's "Ace of Spades" rather than the tired glee-club standards. In time, something remarkable happens -- Arthur finds his voice and remembers how it feels to truly be alive in the moment. Christopher Eccleston co-stars(n)

programme.title: Killing Kennedy
programme.desc: This factual drama, based on Bill O'Reilly's best-selling book Killing Kennedy: The End of Camelot, marks the 50th anniversary of the assassination of President John F Kennedy. Starring Rob Lowe as President Kennedy, Ginnifer Goodwin as Jacqueline Kennedy, Will Rothhaar as Lee Harvey Oswald and Michelle Trachtenberg as Marina Oswald, the programme charts the highs and lows of two lives that would intersect and result in two horrific murders that stunned a nation and marked the end of an era. The film combines rare historical insights and archives with dramatic and emotionally engaging storytelling to recount how a sequence of gunshots in Dallas not only killed a beloved president, but also propelled the nation into the thick of the Vietnam War and a cultural change(n)

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: In the wake of a national tragedy, the prime minister and royal family find themselves quietly at odds. The initial reluctance of Buckingham Palace to mourn Diana is seen by the public as a sign of cool emotional distance. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with Two Parts. Part two of The One with the Two Parts is a hospital farce. Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) has to go to a doctor, but has no insurance. To alleviate the problem, Monica (Courteney Cox) and Rachel switch identities so that Rachel can use Monica's coverage. Complications ensue when the two become attracted to their doctors (guest stars George Clooney and Noah Wyle). Asked out on dates by the cute practitioners, Monica and Rachel begin to bicker over who will date who -- listing each other's worst attributes in front of the doctors. Meanwhile, Joey (Matt LeBlanc) and Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) are not getting along because Joey is still dating Phoebe's twin sister, Ursula, forgetting Phoebe's birthday -- despite the fact that the identical siblings share the same birthday. Finally, Ross (David Schwimmer) is still afraid of being a father until Marcel the Monkey swallows some Scrabble tiles and Ross has to rush him to the hospital. His ability to take care of Marcel convinces him that he can handle fatherhood. This episode originally aired on February 23, 1995(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: Tracks and Trails
programme.desc: Michael Harding explores the best walking and cycling tracks around the country, beginning by following the Miners' Way and Historical Trail from the town of Boyle, Roscommon, to his home in Arigna. Along with his guide, Philip James, the writer and storyteller visits Boyle Abbey - a 12th-century monastery, which was later converted into a military garrison in the 17th century. The pair's next point of interest is Rockingham House, followed by Moylurg Tower - a focal point of the Lough Key Forest and Activity Park. The final stretch of their journey is to the Arigna Mining Experience, where they meet former miner Peter McNiff.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Observational documentary offering an insight into the work of doctors at Putneymead Group Medical Practice in Putney, south-west London. Dr Tim King treats Vittoria, who has been injured during an assault and also has an agonising throat infection, but the real root of her problems is her alcohol dependency and before long the appointment descends into chaos. Dr Ashleigh Helm diagnoses a frightened patient with early onset dementia, while Dr Don McKenzie has a consultation with Harold, a terminal cancer patient who has been told that he has just months to live.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Millionaire environmentalist and scientist Dan Hagen is shot on his boat while out at sea, and all the evidence points toward a robbery gone wrong, but DI Goodman suspects foul play by a crew member. The team soon realises the group are not as close-knit as they initially seem, and with everyone hiding a secret, the pressure is on to get to the bottom of how and why Dan was killed. The case gives the British detective a sudden desire to become a sailor, while Florence surprises the team with her action hero credentials. Caribbean crime drama, starring Kris Marshall and Josephine Jobert.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Ireland
programme.desc: Fergal Keane examines the country's invasion by Anglo-Norman forces, revealing how it mirrored huge upheavals taking place across Europe at the same time. He details how these incursions failed to suppress the Gaelic revival in the 14th century, and explores a theory that, despite her position as one of England's most celebrated rulers, Elizabeth I was threatened by continental powers that planned to usurp her throne by using Ireland as a back door into her domain.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News and Weather

programme.title: Francis Brennan's Grand Tour
programme.sub-title: Francis Brennan's Grand Vietnamese Tour: Ho Chi Minh City.
programme.desc: Francis wakes his party up early for coffee in the park before moving on to the Independence Palace. They meet Dublin-born children's rights campaigner Christina Noble> They move on to the Cao Dai Temple and the famous Cu Chi Tunnels, which proved instrumental in the outcome of the Vietnam War and present a daunting prospect to modern visitors due to torrential rain and resident bats.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt

programme.title: Bobby Jones: Stroke of Genius
programme.desc: Biopic of golfer Bobby Jones, a 14-year-old from Georgia who went on to take the sporting world by storm with his extraordinary talent until his retirement at the age of 28. His career was meteoric, but success and extreme ambition complicated his family life, and his later years were blighted by a degenerative back disorder. programme.desc: Documentary following the first few months in the life of an emperor penguin born in an Antarctic midwinter. Kate Winslet narrates as cameras follow the young bird, watching him learn to survive the dangers of predators and the treacherous landscape of his home, before he is thrown into the ocean for the very first time.(n)

He begins with an assessment of whether the increasingly complex technology in modern planes could be creating new problems, looking at two types of airliner that have experienced technical issues in recent years - the Boeing Dreamliner and the Airbus A380.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock

Drama about a dysfunctional family, starring Emmy Rossum.(n)

programme.desc: The story of a famously lavish five-day party held by the Shah of Iran in 1971 to celebrate 2,500 years of Persian monarchy. The event was held at a specially constructed oasis surrounded by a city of tents and attended by 60 world leaders, who enjoyed a five-course banquet and a pageant featuring thousands of soldiers dressed in historical costume. However, the decadence on display had far-reaching consequences, breeding resentment of the Shah's regime among the Iranian people.(n)

programme.desc: Barry runs into a fellow speedster who is up to no good, while sparks begin to fly between Iris and her new boss.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Having discovered the truth about Zoom's true identity, Barry is more determined than ever to return to Earth-2 and stop his nemesis for good. First, he decides he must find a way to make himself even faster, and travels back through time as part of a clever ruse to trick Dr Harrison Wells - AKA Eobard Thawne - into teaching him how to increase his speed. However, he soon finds himself face-to-face with an old foe - Hartley Rathaway. Superhero action adventure, starring Grant Gustin.(n)

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: Mitch seeks to rescue Clementine from her captors, while a glimpse into Jackson's sister Abigail's past reveals the origins of the hybrids. Sci-fi thriller, starring James Wolk.(n)

programme.title: Colony
programme.desc: As Katie gets dragged back into the resistance, Will tries to help her leave her past behind. Meanwhile, Maddie and Nolan pay a visit to the labour camp.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross heads deep into Madagascar's bandit lands as he investigates how organised and murderous cattle rustling gangs have villagers living in fear in the south-east African republic.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Glasgow, one of his favourite cities, to reveal unusual and often hidden sights and sounds overlooked by the public. Starting at the Necropolis, he travels to the world's oldest music hall before enjoying the views from a city-centre landmark. He also finds the time to take tea with a film star.(n)

programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Santos and Vinick go on air for a debate, in a special episode originally broadcast live and unrehearsed in America. Forrest Sawyer is drafted in to raise issues and generally oversee proceedings. Starring Jimmy Smits and Alan Alda as the rival politicians.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Santos campaign faces a dilemma when a scheduled visit to Los Angeles is thrown into doubt when an unarmed boy is shot by a Latino police officer. Meanwhile, CJ intervenes in a dispute between China and Kazakhstan.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A nanny goes missing along with the baby in her care - but Jack and the team are hard-pressed to decide whether she is the victim of a kidnapping or their prime suspect. Drama, guest starring Chad Lowe, with Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A couple are murdered in a seedy hotel room and evidence shows their daughter was with them but is now missing. Fingerprints lead to a convicted sex offender - a self-styled clergyman - and the discovery of another daughter's existence. Elsewhere, Sara is assigned to train a new recruit as she investigates the mystery of an unidentified homeless man whose death is far from straightforward.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny finds a disorientated man who is covered in blood in a park and struggles to believe he has no recollection of what happened, leaving the detective to piece together the night's events for himself. Meanwhile, Jamie helps an officer cover up the fact he was drunk when he apprehended an armed robber while off duty. Starring Donnie Wahlberg and Will Estes.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor returns to explore more of the world's most luxurious hotels and begins in Miami's South Beach, home to some of the most hedonistic and extravagant establishments in America. At the Fontainebleau, he meets a man with eye-opening stories about Frank Sinatra's regular visits and gets a shock when he discovers how much it costs to hire a booth in the night club. Richard also gatecrashes swimwear fashion week at the Raleigh Hotel, where he speaks to the event manager about the many celebrity parties he has organised.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As China and Kazahkstan hover on the verge of war, Santos works on his campaign strategy. Ellie prepares for her wedding, while Abbey greets the guests, but President Bartlet is held up by his duties. Carol shows up on the scene, and Josh's job is threatened by disgruntled party loyalists.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The vice presidential debate between Leo McGarry and Ray Sullivan looms but Josh remains unconvinced of his candidate's abilities in the public arena. Meanwhile, Santos visits his family in Texas where his brother threatens to cause a stir.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The winner of a makeover reality show disappears. Jack and the team learn she was a plain-faced book-keeper who suffered from depression before plastic surgery transformed her into a celebrity. As inquiries gather pace, they try to identify a man's voice heard on her answering machine. Anthony LaPaglia stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.sub-title: The Case of the Cross-Dressing Carp.
programme.desc: A teenager saving money to fund a sex change is found stabbed and hanging from a tree. The victim's phone leads the team to a hydrologist the youngster had been helping - but before they get a chance to interview him, he is also murdered. Meanwhile, Ronnie is excited at the possibility that her latest case could be a 1960s Mob hit.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: The Night Of
programme.desc: Naz is transferred to Rikers Island, where he is acquainted with prison kingpin Freddy, who presents him with an offer. Crime drama, starring Riz Ahmed.(n)

programme.desc: Confronted with a crisis involving one of their own, Ray and his team plan how to use art from the Kovitzsky gallery as leverage. Meanwhile, Hector reaches breaking point.(n)

Meanwhile, Sir Benjamin Slade hopes a murder mystery weekend at Maunsel House in Somerset will help pay off a sizeable electricity bill.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Everyday life at Northumberland's Chillingham Castle, where the members of staff try to tactfully deal with the whims of their employer, baronet Humphry Wakefield, as the estate prepares to welcome a band of ghost-hunting tourists. Meanwhile, Carlton Towers in East Yorkshire hosts an annual dog show for Afghan hounds.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard try to impress American guests at Carlton Towers with a programme of traditional activities, including skinning rabbits and taking high tea. Meanwhile, Sir Humphry Wakefield entertains tourists on a wine-tasting weekend at Chillingham Castle.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The documentary series concludes by telling the story of 20th-century Britain, including the many ways in which the nation was transformed by the two world wars. The programme explores the changing role of women through the decades, and examines some of the scientific and technological advances that had a significant impact on everyday life.(n)

programme.title: A Plastic Tide
programme.desc: Over 8 million tonnes of plastic enters oceans each year, and it's killing sea life. This documentary reveals that it is also impacting our food chain with unknown health effects.(n)

programme.title: A Plastic Whale
programme.desc: A special report on the devastating effects of plastic on ocean wildlife, after a post-mortem of a Cuvier's beaked whale confirmed its intestines were entirely clogged with plastic.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A renowned cancer specialist is found to have fluid in his lungs and insists he should be allowed to die. House agrees, but stipulates that his staff must first be allowed 24 hours to come up with a cure for his condition. Hugh Laurie and Lisa Edelstein star, with guest Joel Grey.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A boy's uncontrollable screaming gives the grumpy doctor and his colleagues another medical mystery to solve. Meanwhile, House refuses to work in his office until Cuddy returns his old bloodstained carpet. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A couple develop identical stomach pains after a terrifying ordeal, and as the woman's condition worsens, the go-ahead for a biopsy is left up to her husband. Meanwhile, House's bedside manner lands him in trouble with another patient. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.desc: The team searches for a recently blinded girl and her mobility instructor, who were abducted during a camping trip. Jack's wife tells him she wants a divorce, and Vivian takes over as supervisor. Starring Anthony LaPaglia and Marianne Jean-Baptiste.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A hospital worker disappears on a quiet rural road while changing a flat tyre, and the detectives' investigation reveals she is wanted in connection with the bombing of an abortion clinic. Anthony LaPaglia, Poppy Montgomery and Marianne Jean-Baptiste star.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace

Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Sausage Party
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum.(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton.(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Nerds
programme.desc: Two social outcasts set up their own college fraternity for similarly un-hip students to give the campus sporting jocks a run for their money. Comedy, starring Anthony Edwards, Robert Carradine, Ted McGinley and Timothy Busfield.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege
programme.desc: The clueless cops return yet again, this time to thwart the machinations of a crime lord behind a wave of raids and robberies in the city. Unfortunately, they are unaware Mr Big is always one step ahead thanks to a police informer. Penultimate entry in the comedy series, starring Bubba Smith, David Graf, Michael Winslow, Matt McCoy and Leslie Easterbrook.(n)

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the sci-fi action sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Norbit
programme.desc: A timid man's life is ruined after he is bullied into marrying an overbearing, overweight woman. However, a more hopeful future beckons when he bumps into his childhood sweetheart and realises she is his one true love - but first he has to pluck up the courage to confront his tyrannical wife. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy in multiple roles alongside Thandie Newton, Cuba Gooding Jr and Terry Crews.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A by-the-book Los Angeles cop is paired with a laidback new partner to investigate the nefarious activities of a TV evangelist and a pornographic-magazine baron suspected of operating a criminal cult. Comedy spoof of the 1950s TV series, starring Dan Aykroyd, Tom Hanks, Christopher Plummer and the original show's star Harry Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: When it becomes obvious that his solo album is a flop, a former boy band member does everything he can to maintain his celebrity status. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg, Jorma Taccone and Akiva Schaffer.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie
programme.desc: The indomitable Irish matriarch discovers that a plan is afoot by developers to buy the famous Dublin street market where her family has run a fruit and veg stall for generations. Assembling a band of eccentric allies, she plans to fight back, only to realise her daughter is not interested in taking over the family business. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Jennifer Gibney.(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: When it becomes obvious that his solo album is a flop, a former boy band member does everything he can to maintain his celebrity status. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg, Jorma Taccone and Akiva Schaffer.(n)

programme.title: Bad Neighbours 2
programme.desc: A couple seek the aid of a former rival in fighting back against the raucous college sorority that moves in next door to them. Comedy, starring Seth Rogen and Zac Efron.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie

Assembling a band of eccentric allies, she plans to fight back, only to realise her daughter is not interested in taking over the family business. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Jennifer Gibney.(n)

programme.title: The Great Mouse Detective
programme.desc: The evil Professor Ratigan masterminds a cunning plan to become supreme ruler of all mousedom by kidnapping a clever toy-maker and forcing him to participate in his evil schemes - but super-sleuth Basil of Baker Street is soon on the case. Animated adventure, with the voices of Vincent Price, Barrie Ingham, Val Bettin and Alan Young.(n)

programme.title: Bambi II
programme.desc: The young fawn is reunited with his father, a wise stag, in the aftermath of his mother's death. The older animal reluctantly takes on his parental responsibilities, teaching his son the ways of the forest and helping him find the courage to face the challenges ahead. Disney animated prequel, with the voices of Patrick Stewart and Alexander Gould.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Moana
programme.desc: To save her island home from a terrible curse, a brave Polynesian teenager must set sail and journey into the great blue yonder. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Frankenweenie
programme.desc: A lonely boy uses electricity to bring his dead dog back to life. However, the presence of the animal in the neighbourhood leads to panic over a monster, while the young scientist's classmates are soon also meddling with life and death to revive their own pets. Tim Burton's stop-motion animated fantasy, with the voices of Charlie Tahan and Winona Ryder.(n)

programme.title: Moana
programme.desc: To save her island home from a terrible curse, a brave Polynesian teenager must set sail and journey into the great blue yonder. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison.(n)

Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)
